Mercury and acid batteries are single-use batteries. They are crafted fully charged but cannot be re-charged. Once their stored energy is depleted, they can be placed in an extractor to be converted back into small battery hulls.

They can be placed in the battery slot of any standard LV gregtech machine, in that case they will be depleted before the machine's internal EU storage. They can also be used in LV battery buffers.

questDatabase.name: Single use battery: Acid
questDatabase.description:
Mercury and acid Batteries are single-use batteries. They are crafted fully charged but cannot be re-charged. Once their stored energy is depleted, they can be placed in an extractor to be converted back into small battery hulls.

They can be placed in the battery slot in any standard LV gregtech machine, in that case they will be depleted before the machine's internal EU storage. They can also be used in LV battery buffers.

questDatabase.name: Reusable battery: Sodium
questDatabase.description: Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any gregtech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

questDatabase.name: Reusable battery: Cadmium
questDatabase.description: Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any gregtech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

questDatabase.name: Reusable battery: Lithium
questDatabase.description: Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any gregtech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

questDatabase.name: Mercury
questDatabase.description: Mercury can be centrifuged out of redstone. If you find some cinnabar ore in the redstone vein you can use that too.

questDatabase.name: Fluid canner
questDatabase.description:
The fluid canner is a fundamental machine, since it is necessary to move fluids around, as well as for filling tin cells, glass bottles, buckets, and even batteries. Most cases you can use the small GT++ tanks instead.

Another interesting thing about the fluid canner is that it can be transformed into a raintank, by attaching a drain cover on its top (Any machine with a tank actually can be...).

questDatabase.name: Sulfuric acid
questDatabase.description: Combining sulfur trioxide and water in the chemical reactor will give you sulfuric acid for your single use acid batteries. If you have made some light or heavy fuel already maybe you have some spare hydrogen sulfide. If not, you can always make sulfuric acid with some sulfur and water in the chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: Battery buffer
questDatabase.description: Batteries can be placed directly in machines. To recharge a battery you need a battery buffer. Buffers can also power an energy network. They come in different sizes: 1, 4, 9 and 16 slots. They can draw 2A and output 1A per battery inserted - watch your wire amperage!

questDatabase.name: IC2 Battery
questDatabase.description: Some recipes require IC2 batteries. Fill your small battery hull with some molten redstone and you will get your RE-Battery. Molten cells will hurt you, so be careful.

questDatabase.name: How to get sodium
questDatabase.description: A second source for sodium is glauconite ore or glauconite sand. This type of ore vein can be found at Y level 20-50.

questDatabase.name: How to get sodium/lithium
questDatabase.description:
Salt ore mixes can be found in the Overworld between Y level 50-70. Salt isn't only used to get sodium, it's an important ingredient in many pam's harvestcraft food recipes.

Hint: Lepidolite and spodumene are good sources of lithium for your batteries.

questDatabase.name: A big meteorite
questDatabase.description:
The best way to get rare earth is to find an applied energistics 2 meteorite and grind the blocks into dust. Maybe you completed the quest in the steam age and stored your crushed skystone somewhere? That dust can now be centrifuged into various byproducts like cadmium, neodymium, caesium, lanthanum, and yttrium.

Hint: Redstone has rare earth as byproduct. Chalcopyrite (at HV level) and sphalherite (at LV level) have cadmium as byproduct.

questDatabase.name: Basic canner
questDatabase.description: The canning machine is mainly used to fill tin cans with any kind of food (HV Tier), but it is useful for filling and emptying tin cells with other solid items than food, usually in the form of dust. It can also fill batteries with sulfur, mercury, cadmium, lithium or sodium.

questDatabase.name: Packing your tanks chests and barrels
questDatabase.description:
Packing your chests and barrels without spilling all the things (buildcraft(tm))? 
No problem! Make a dolly and you can carry your full chests, barrels or storage drawers anywhere you want. But be warned, you will get a slowness debuff so hopefully you don't have to travel very far. Not portable buildcraft and iron tanks can moved so too without loosing fluids.

PS Later on you can fly or make a traveller's belt to get around the debuff.

questDatabase.name: Portable mob spawners..? Cool!
questDatabase.description: Do you want to move the spawners around and build some cool mob farms? That will be no problem if you get the diamond dolly.

questDatabase.name: Grain bait
questDatabase.description: Crafting some nice grain bait for your animal trap.

questDatabase.name: Fruit bait
questDatabase.description: Crafting some tasty fruit bait for your animal trap.

questDatabase.name: Veggie bait
questDatabase.description: Crafting some veggie bait for your animal trap.

questDatabase.name: Fish bait
questDatabase.description: Crafting some fish bait for your fish trap.

questDatabase.name: Animal trapping
questDatabase.description: Tired of hunting for cows, zombies or sheep? You can build a trap and hope some animal or monster drops will be caught by the netting inside.

questDatabase.name: A fisherman's friend
questDatabase.description: Have you ever tried to catch a fish with your bare hands? It's time to craft a fishing rod and get some fish the easy way. Cast your fishing rod in some water and wait until the bobber dips below the surface. Then reel back in your line and hopefully you caught yourself something nice.

questDatabase.name: Fish trapping
questDatabase.description: Fishing can be very boring. Why not to automate it with a fish trap?

questDatabase.name: Wheat time
questDatabase.description: It's time to plant some wheat to make some bread or to prepare grain bait for your animal traps.

questDatabase.name: Floury flurry
questDatabase.description:
The first step in making bread is to macerate your wheat into flour with a mortar or a macerator.

Flour can be used in many food recipes for different pam's harvestcraft foods.

questDatabase.name: First handmade bread
questDatabase.description:
Baking your dough in a Furnace makes some tasty bread.
Your first bread!

questDatabase.name: Do'h!
questDatabase.description:
Water and flour makes a dough or two...
Dough can be used in many different food recipes from pam's harvestcraft.

questDatabase.name: Tasty toast
questDatabase.description: Smelt your bread again and you get some toast! Give's you more nutrition points, and unlocks more culinary potential!

questDatabase.name: Sulfuric naphtha
questDatabase.description: Another distillate you can make out of oil is sulfuric naphtha with a burn value of 40,000 EU per cell in the gas turbine.

questDatabase.name: LPG
questDatabase.description: Centrifuging some Butane or Propane gives you LPG with a burn value of 320,000 EU, the same as naphtha. Also it is a way to get methane and eventually epichlorohydrin.

questDatabase.name: Naphtha
questDatabase.description:
You can process sulfuric naphtha to fluid naphtha which has a burn value of 320,000 EU in the gas turbine.
Naphtha is also a base product for polyethylene and polycaprolactam - a great substitute for string.

questDatabase.name: Sulfuric gas
questDatabase.description: Another distillate for your gas turbine you can make out of oil is sulfuric gas with a burn value of 25,000 EU per cell.

questDatabase.name: Refinery gas
questDatabase.description: Refine your gas in a chemical reactor with hydrogen gas to give it a better burn value of 160,000 EU, and maybe use it to make methane gas.

questDatabase.name: Methane
questDatabase.description: Distilling some "refinery gases" gives you some methane gas. There are many more ways to get methane.

questDatabase.name: Glider wings
questDatabase.description: If for some reason you want to be able to jump down a cliff without getting the message "Player X fell from a high place". A great idea would be to find a way to soften your landing first. The hang glider should do that just fine.

questDatabase.name: Electrotine battery
questDatabase.description:
The electrotine battery is exclusively used in project red machines and the jetpack.
Electrotine is a mixture of redstone and electrum dust.

questDatabase.name: Electrotine jetpack
questDatabase.description:
Your glider gets you to the ground safely but it does not have any method to get up. After you researched electrotine you discovered that it is powerful enough for your first jetpack.
A diamond chestplate surrounded with 4 electrotine batteries is powerful enough to bring you up in the air.

It does not have a hover mode so you better take your glider with you. 

Hint: This jetpack can't fly higher than Y level 128.

questDatabase.name: Refill your jetpack
questDatabase.description:
GREAT.... you now have an empty jetpack.
You need 25 electrotine dust to completely fill it.
Let's craft an electrotine generator and a charging bench to use the power of electrotine. 
You will very quickly discover that, while it is fast and cheap, it's empty in the blink of an eye. Despite this, it is useful in combination with the hang glider to get into the air and to get away from hairy situations.

questDatabase.name: Coal steam jetpack
questDatabase.description:
Your coal jetpack needs coal and water to produce steam. After a short warm-up period you can go and take it for a ride. Keep in mind you will need your glider to make a soft landing.

Put your jetpack on your back and hit Shift and the adventure backpacks action-key to start it.

Max flying height for these jetpacks is the Y level of 185.

Vertical velocity decreases linearly with height after overcoming optimal height - 135 for jetpack and 100 for copter.

questDatabase.name: Copter jetpack
questDatabase.description:
The copter jetpack is the first jetpack with a hover mode. It is using all kind of different fuel types in buckets. 
Buckets of creosote, lava, oil, cetane, diesel,ethanol, and fuel will work.
Equip your jetpack and hit Shift and the adventure backpacks action-key. You can also switch between hover and normal mode.

Max flying height is limited to Y level 200. 

Vertical velocity decreases linearly with height after overcoming optimal height - 135 for jetpack and 100 for copter.

questDatabase.name: Electric jetpack
questDatabase.description:
Your first electrical jetpack. You need to hit the IC2 mode-switch key to toggle between normal mode and hover mode.

The only limitation is that you can't fly higher than Y level 185.

questDatabase.name: Fueled jetpack
questDatabase.description:
This jetpack uses IC2 biogas and can fly up to Y level 245.
You can switch between hover and normal mode using the IC2 mode-switch key.

Your jetpack can be (re-)fueled in the IC2 fluid canner with 30 buckets/cells worth of biogas.

questDatabase.name: Advanced electric jetpack
questDatabase.description:
The advanced electric jetpack is an upgraded version of the electric jetpack.
While worn in the chest armor slot and charged with EU, it allows the player to fly. It provides no armor protection, but will charge tools being used in the same manner as the advanced lappack from its 3.000.000 EU internal storage.

The advanced electric jetpack is limited to a maximum flying height of Y level 256.

questDatabase.name: Advanced nano chestplate
questDatabase.description: Combining the advanced electric jetpack and nanosuit yields you the advanced nano chestplate. Now you have the protection of the chestplate combined with the freedom of movement of the jetpack.

questDatabase.name: Gravi suit
questDatabase.description: The gravi chestplate is the ultimate quantum armor combined with a high powered jetpack. It also has hidden features that you need to discover while wearing the whole quantum armor.

questDatabase.name: Iron shields
questDatabase.description: You have been using your hide shield long enough. After you make your first tools, grab a bit of iron ore and make a nice iron shield.

questDatabase.name: Stone spear
questDatabase.description:
Upgrade your wooden spear with a stone arrowhead and iron screws to a stone spear.
This spear has better durability than the wooden one.

questDatabase.name: Iron spear
questDatabase.description:
Upgrade your wooden spear with an iron arrowhead and two steel screws to an iron spear. 
The iron spear has better durability than the stone variant.

questDatabase.name: Diamond spear
questDatabase.description:
At MV Tier you can upgrade your iron spear to a diamond one. Get a diamond arrowhead, two stainless steel screws and a wooden spear.
This spear has superior durability.

questDatabase.name: Diamond shield
questDatabase.description: Your iron shield got very old. With a shield made from diamond plates you can maintain block for up to 5 seconds.

questDatabase.name: Bow, arrows and quiver
questDatabase.description:
Wow, your first handmade *ehm* machine made bow. You find out that you can put the bow in the mine and blade battlegears slots. Now it's time to make a quiver and maybe some arrows. You can put up to 4 stacks of arrows in your quiver.

Let's go hunt a bit.

questDatabase.name: Basic arc furnace
questDatabase.description: The arc furnace is an alternative to smelting stuff back into components and making wrought iron. The recipes use oxygen and 3 amperes of power.

questDatabase.name: Faster steel production
questDatabase.description: A faster alternative to steel production is to use the arc furnace and smelt the iron ingots into wrought iron ingots. Then macerate them to dust and smelt them very fast in the EBF to steel. (Some might even dare arc furnacing the dust itself...)

questDatabase.name: LV battery buffer 9 slots
questDatabase.description:
Upgrade your battery buffer to hold 9 batteries which allows max 9 ampere output.
Useful for your EBF and the arc furnace.

questDatabase.name: Kitchenware
questDatabase.description:
To cook some healthy food you need a few tools crafted first.
Saucepan, 
pot, 
rolling pin, 
mortar, 
mixing bowl, 
soft mallet, 
skillet, 
knife...

questDatabase.name: Row, row, row your boat
questDatabase.description:
You live close to the water and don't have a boat?
You need wooden planks, slabs and a knife to craft one. (This is also quest id 666, be careful, something is going on.)

questDatabase.name: Trainspotting
questDatabase.description:
The wooden tracks can be made without any machine. Functionally equivalent to normal rails, but with a lower maximum speed (for safety reasons).

Hint: You can use your wooden rails for Steve's carts farms.

questDatabase.name: Rubber boat
questDatabase.description: The rubber dinghy requires only a few rubber plates. Like the vanilla wooden boat, it will break and dismantle whenever it hits a surface, however instead of returning sticks and planks, it will return a damaged rubber dinghy, which can be re-crafted with two pieces of rubber back into a useable rubber dinghy!

questDatabase.name: Inflatable boot
questDatabase.description: I meant to say boat... The inflatable boat is the first boat that doesn't break on impact with a solid block.

questDatabase.name: Carbon fiber boat
questDatabase.description:
Unlike all other boats, this amazing carbon fiber canoe is COMPLETELY INDESTRUCTIBLE!* This means that you can smash it into as many beaches, lily pads and alligators as you like, the carbon fiber canoe won't take a scratch!

Warning: We are not held responsible for any damage caused by riding the carbon fiber canoe into a lava lake or the Void.

*Therefore, warranty is NOT included.

questDatabase.name: Electric boat
questDatabase.description: The electric boat works mostly like a vanilla boat, chugging through the water at a decent pace. It will hopefully drop itself once you crash, which is slightly nicer than the usual sticks. That's all well and good, but what if we utilize the electric engine? Wearing an energy storage device in your chestplate slot, like a batpack or energypack, will cause the boat to drain energy from it and propel you forward at supersonic speed! Doing this will consume about 100 EU per block traveled, so even a decent batpack won't last long!

questDatabase.name: Boat shape?
questDatabase.description:
Really? Yes for the more advanced boats you need a new shape form.
You need to make an Extruder first to progress further.

questDatabase.name: LV extruder
questDatabase.description: The extruder is not very useful in the LV age. But it will extrude your next tier of boat, make rubber sheets more efficiently, or make some Tinkers Construct tool parts.

questDatabase.name: Wooden rail variants
questDatabase.description:
The wooden junction, wye and switch tracks need an assembling machine to craft. They allow you to join and switch to tracks going to different locations.

Nei not shows the right recipe on the first page. Switch a bit through the recipes to find the right one.

questDatabase.name: Switch lever
questDatabase.description:
The switch lever is the manual version of the switch motor, requiring a player to operate it instead of a redstone signal. 
It is used in various signaling systems, mainly to change the way switch tracks and wye tracks work.

questDatabase.name: Crowbar
questDatabase.description:
The crowbar comes in a Railcraft and a gregtech variant. It is used to manipulate machines from railcraft, remove plates and any other covers (pumps, conveyor belts, etc.) from gregtech pipes and machines as well as breaking certain objects faster, such as tracks. This tool is also used to access certain inventories from Railcraft.
Hold a crowbar and shift + right click to attach carts. Click the starting cart then continue to click to add more carts to the link. Carts will act slower the more connections are made.

The crowbar can be used as a weapon, though it costs twice as much durability on attack (just like any other non weapon tool...).

questDatabase.name: Minecart
questDatabase.description:
After you craft your first cart the journey can begin...
Well, not really. You will need some kind of tracks first.

questDatabase.name: Fast Food > Slow Food
questDatabase.description: Three fast food lootbags give a better one = Slow Food Lootbag. (Since when is slow food better?)

questDatabase.name: Slow Food > Haute Cuisine
questDatabase.description: Three slow food lootbags give a better one = Haute Cuisine Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: Haute Cuisine > Dessert
questDatabase.description: Six haute cuisine lootbags give a better one = Dessert Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: Transportation Class 3 > Transportation Class 2
questDatabase.description: Three transportation class 3 lootbags give a better one = Transportation Class 2 Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: Transportation Class 2 > Transportation Class 1
questDatabase.description: Three transportation class 2 Lootbags give a better one = Transportation Class 1 Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: Wet dirt armor?
questDatabase.description: If you don't have any armor, "mud armor" is better than nothing. Mud can be found in some wet biomes.

questDatabase.name: Wooden armor
questDatabase.description: If you can't find mud you can make very poor armor out of wood. Cutting down a few trees to make a set should do. You will need a soft mallet too, so save a few logs for that.

questDatabase.name: Armor 2.0
questDatabase.description: Iron armor is much better than the leather armor. Especially when you have to go outside during the night.

questDatabase.name: Leather armor
questDatabase.description:
Killing some cows will give you enough leather to craft a complete set of leather armor. 

Hint: You are able to dye this armor.

questDatabase.name: Bronze armor
questDatabase.description: Bronze armor has the same abilities as iron armor. Same durability, same protection and same enchantment capability.

questDatabase.name: "Nice to have" armor
questDatabase.description: The gold armor is a "nice to have" armor. The durability is very low but you look expensive when you wear it.

questDatabase.name: "Oh shiny" armor
questDatabase.description: Diamond armor is the best armor in Vanilla Minecraft, but over here there are much better armors available.

questDatabase.name: Fancy armor
questDatabase.description: Not really better but fancy. The chain mail armor is made out of steel rings.

questDatabase.name: Armor 2.5
questDatabase.description: The steel armor has more durability than the iron/bronze or chainmail armor.

questDatabase.name: Composite vest
questDatabase.description: Combining the strength of advanced alloy plates with the steel chestplate makes your vest very hard. Now you have double the durability and increased armor points by 1.5.

questDatabase.name: Fallen from the sky
questDatabase.description:
There are big meteors everywhere and you are wondering why you need to mine them now?
Skystone is a good source of rare earth metals in the LV age. 
Inside the meteor you can find a skystone chest containing some processor press plates. Save them for later, as they are really important. Plus the chest is nice, and can be placed underneath blocks and still opened.

Hint: If your all your surface meteors have been raided, put some skystone in your orefinder to find underground ones.  Often there is a second meteor right next to the one on the surface!

questDatabase.name: One Anvil... Better make that two!
questDatabase.description:
With your brand-new Compressor you are able to make some metal blocks for your new anvil. Better craft two anvils, one will be required for the forge hammer.

With the anvil you can repair, rename and enchant armor and tools.

questDatabase.name: Automation tier 1
questDatabase.description:
Do you want to automate your smeltery because you are planning to make stacks of glass blocks? 
No problem, craft a large bronze pipe and place it under the faucet. Now the molten fluid will flow inside the pipe. Under or next to the pipe you have to place the casting basins or tables.
A hopper and a chest underneath would auto-output products. NOTE: Faucets will output precisely 144L each activation if you toggle it off immediately. That's going to have some uses later on...

questDatabase.name: Automation tier 2
questDatabase.description: You want a better automation than using pipes? Sure, craft a comparator and link it with redstone dust placed on the ground. The redstone needs to be adjacent to the faucet to activate the crafting process.

questDatabase.name: 2x steel
questDatabase.description: Steel production is so slow. If you got enough bricks and clay, build a second BBF. Build it attached to the first one, so they can share a wall and you will save some bricks, clay and concrete.

questDatabase.name: 4x steel
questDatabase.description: Not even two BBFs are fast enough...Can you figure out how to save the most bricks making 4?

questDatabase.name: Why one coke oven when you can have ten?
questDatabase.description:
Your bricked blast furnace uses coal like hell and your steam boiler too? Well it's time to make more coke ovens and automate them a bit. Wooden fluid pipes and tin item pipes will help you reach your goal.

Search NEI for a more efficient way to make coke oven bricks.

questDatabase.name: How dark can you go?
questDatabase.description: Seriously, how dark can one be? You are sure the face in that crystal was nothing but imagination...

questDatabase.name: Ascended
questDatabase.description: You feel empowered, light, almost like a ghost.

questDatabase.name: Tier 5 slates
questDatabase.description: 1023 Buckets of blood in one slate! How much more I can store, oh I wish I would know. Then I add one and check if it works. 1024 buckets of blood in one slate! ... ...

questDatabase.name: Powerful shards
questDatabase.description: The demons summoned are rather strong, but their souls contain immense power!

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 slates
questDatabase.description: Tier 4 slates: Getting close.

questDatabase.name: Accelerated plant growth
questDatabase.description: Plants grow very slowly, you might've discovered that by now. So why you don't counter that? A watering can will come in handy very soon.

questDatabase.name: Ethereal chalk
questDatabase.description: Top tier chalk, for fancy wall paintings?

questDatabase.name: Archmage orb. Let them come!
questDatabase.description: Your tier 5 orb.

questDatabase.name: Master orb: Getting close
questDatabase.description: Your tier 4 orb.

questDatabase.name: Elemental chalk II
questDatabase.description: Enhanced elemental chalk, to write "darker" runes than you're used to...

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 runes
questDatabase.description: You will want both runes. Rune of superior capacity to increase the storage of your blood altar, and rune of the orb. Later it is required if you want to advance to higher levels.

questDatabase.name: Tier 5 runes
questDatabase.description: The final frontier: There are not many runes available. The acceleration rune allows you to speed up the interaction with external tanks.

questDatabase.name: Advanced rituals
questDatabase.description: More powerful rituals require dusk runes. With your new dusk chalk, you can enhance your ritual diviner to place those. Allowing you to perform a lot more rituals.

questDatabase.name: Highend rituals
questDatabase.description: The last rune so far, used for the most powerful rituals.

questDatabase.name: Convocation of the damned
questDatabase.description: Time to open a portal to the demons we're using all the time. What could possibly go wrong? (It is recommended to do this ritual on a planet, as the demon city will spread quite a bit...)

questDatabase.name: Imbued spell upgrades
questDatabase.description: With these new shards you are able to craft the most powerful spell components. Maybe it's time to upgrade your mining spell?

questDatabase.name: Find some Certus Quartz
questDatabase.description: The Nether is full of different kinds of quartz. For the emitter and the sensor you will need to find some certus quartz.

questDatabase.name: Good Circuits
questDatabase.description: Good circuits are an improvement on basic circuits. They are a component of all MV gregtech machines. Be sure you build the electric blast furnace first, so you can process some aluminium dust into ingots.

questDatabase.name: Crop Breeding
questDatabase.description:
If you ever wanted to know how crop breeding works you are in the right place. Get some crops (the sticks) and some seeds from farming with a hoe or mattock.
Make a plot of farmland with your tool and place water in the middle. Make sure the area is well lit and quite big. 
Now place crop sticks in each corner of the field. Then place the seeds on the sticks and wait a bit.
When they are fully grown you can put double crop sticks in the remaining spots by using crop sticks on already placed crop sticks.
With some luck you might get a new unknown seed which can be scanned later.
Weeds need to be removed with a trowel otherwise your field will become overgrown by them.

questDatabase.name: First Breeding
questDatabase.description: New plants have grown on your crop sticks. You can harvest the crop by right clicking it or by left clicking with a seed bag eventually - this will destroy the plant though. Collect 8 seeds of any kind.

questDatabase.name: Weed II
questDatabase.description:
Weeds, weeds, and more weeds. You get so many of them while cross breeding. 
Need some  biogas cells for your power production in exchange? Or maybe some glowstone to light up your fields?

questDatabase.name: Unknown seeds no more
questDatabase.description:
You have a lot of unknown seeds already. Use your scanner to scan all the seeds. 
Seeds can be planted again to breed better and more resilient crops.

questDatabase.name: Speed up your plant growth
questDatabase.description: To speed up the growth process a bit you can use a fertilizer. You will note, however, that bone meal no longer works. A bit of ash, apatite or calcite mixed with some distilled water in a chemical reactor will give you the fertilizer you need.

questDatabase.name: Potatos, Carrots, Pumpkins and Melons
questDatabase.description:
Your seeds have three different values: Growth, gain, and resistance (GGR).

The only way to change a crop's GGR without 3rd party tools is through cross breeding. When two plants cross-breed, the resulting plant will have a GGR score that is between both "parent" plants' GGR. Sometimes it will also be a little bit higher or lower. Thus, to obtain high GGR scores you must go through numerous generations of crossbreeding.

The highest score for GGR is 31.

questDatabase.name: Weed
questDatabase.description: Weed will show up from time to time on your crop sticks. Be careful and harvest the weed with your weed trowel before the whole field becomes overgrown with them and they destroy all your plants. Later you can make some weed Ex to destroy it.

questDatabase.name: Flower Power
questDatabase.description: Growing dyes on crops sticks? Try to plant some flowers. If you cross breed Rose and Dandelion flowers you maybe get a new flower and new dyes with different colors.

questDatabase.name: Chemical rubber production
questDatabase.description: A much more efficient way to make insulated cables is by making molten rubber in a chemical reactor which can be applied to a cable in the assembling machine. When you put both machines next to each other you can output the molten rubber directly to the assembling machine by clicking the fluid auto-output button on the chemical reactor. Make sure to set the correct side of the reactor as output side by wrenching it.

questDatabase.name: Better than barrels
questDatabase.description: While barrels offer a slot for a single item, drawers can have up to 4 slots each (holding 16 stacks per slot). Once you reach HV you can combine them with some ProjectRed pipes to set up a "ghetto ME storage system" (Tec2k17)

questDatabase.name: Compact Drawers
questDatabase.description: They are very compact and add some fanciness to your glorious dirt base.

questDatabase.name: Framing Drawers
questDatabase.description: Now you can really make some swaggy and even FANCIER drawers using this table, all you have to do is place some decorative blocks (works with almost ALL decorative blocks) and it will take their texture, the TOP left is the outer Square bottom left is for the front face and top right is for the borders.

questDatabase.name: Bio Fuels
questDatabase.description:
You are using steam, creosote, and possibly oil plus their by-products to generate Power. It's time to start with bio diesel. You can use wheat, sugarcane, apples, saplings or fish.

Be sure you have a managed Forestry farm, Steve's Cart Farm, IC2 Crop Sticks with a harvester, or a lot of fish catchers because you need plenty of biomaterials for constant biodiesel production.

Hint: Hazelnut is the ultimative source for biodiesel.

questDatabase.name: Plant balls
questDatabase.description: The first step is to compress plantballs out of your wheat. Your LV compressor is too slow for it. I suggest crafting 4 MV compressors for the new bio diesel processing line.

questDatabase.name: Plant Mass
questDatabase.description: Macerate the plantballs down to plant mass for better processing. In the LV and MV tiers you get only one plant mass per, in HV tier you recieve two. IV macerator gives up to four of them with a chance of 50% and 25%.

questDatabase.name: Bio Chaff
questDatabase.description: Plant mass needs to be centrifuged into bio chaff, the base material to make biomass. You need 1 or 2 MV centrifuges to run the new production line.

questDatabase.name: Way One: IC 2 Fluid Canner
questDatabase.description: The first way you get biomass out of bio chaff is to use the IC2 Fluid Canner. One bucket of water and one bio chaff gives one bucket of biomass. In HV Tier you can use the pyrolyze oven to do it in a more efficient way.

questDatabase.name: Way Two: Brewery
questDatabase.description: If you are lucky and find some brewing stands or familiar enough with Thaumcraft to make one you can craft a brewery. You get 750mb of biomass out of 750mb water and 1 bio chaff. In HV tier you can use the pyrolyze oven to do it in a more efficient way.

questDatabase.name: Fermented Biomass
questDatabase.description:
With the MV fermenter you can produce fermented biomass. This is the base product to make methane, ethanol and methanol.
When you reach HV tier there's a more efficient way to process it - the distillation tower multiblock.

questDatabase.name: Can u eat those?
questDatabase.description:
No you can't eat them but you can add them to your routed pipes. Without chips routed pipes can't do anything on their own, chips also have a GUI to configure them wich can be opened by right clicking. 
There are 8 types of chips:

-Item extractor chip can be used to send items from its inventory to responder, dynamic responder, terminator and overflow responder chips in a pipe network. 

-Item responder chip will request items from the extractor chips in your network wich match the filter configured to the inventory connected to the responder chip. Chips with higher priority value will receive items first until the inventory is full then will be sent to other inventories with valid filters and remaining space.

-Dynamic item responder chip will request items from the extractor chips in your network that match items inside the dynamic item responder connected inventory. This chip has to be in the same interface pipe as the item responder chip in order to work. Priority rules apply here as well. 

-Item overflow responder works exactly the same as the item responder chip, however it only accepts items that cannot go to an item responder chip, dynamic item responder chip, or item terminator chip. 

-Item terminator chip works as a backup for responder chips.

-Item broadcaster chip will show you the inventory connected to the routed request pipe on the pipe network and can be used to retrieve items from it. They can also extract from the side you configure. 

-Item stock keeper chip will constantly check the network for items and pull them to its pipe. If the chip is set to pull when empty, it will only pull if the inventory next to it is empty, otherwise it will pull when there are less items in the inventory than configured in the chip.

-Item crafting chips craft things. 

-Item crafting extension chips are placed inside the item crafting chips. Make sure you randomize the id.

questDatabase.name: Routed Pipes
questDatabase.description:
There are six types of routed pipes: 

-Junction pipe is used to form an intersection that will allow other routed pipes to communicate. 

-Interface pipe will connect to an inventory allowing you to extract or insert items, chips can be used to control the logic. 

-Request pipe will allow requesting only specific items to be send through pipes.

-Firewall pipe can control which items can pass through them.

questDatabase.name: Ghetto ME System
questDatabase.description:
Now that you are familiar with the mod it's time to organize items in your base a bit. These are the things you need in order to get a basic extract/insert system.

First of all you will need a drawer controller. You can pick it from here or craft it yourself and place it down. Next to it add as much drawers as you want, and make sure they are touching each other or the controller.

The next step is to connect a routed interface pipe to your drawer controller. Take the item responder chip and configure it to filter mode: blacklist (this will allow you to get any items from your system) and add the chip to the routed interface pipe by right clicking on it. Don't forget the dynamic item responder.

In order to allow your system to be able to see items you need to add the item broadcast chip TO THE SAME ROUTED INTERFACE PIPE WHICH IS CONNECTED TO THE DRAWER CONTROLLER.

The last step is to connect a routed request pipe IN THE SAME NETWORK AS THE ROUTED INTERFACE PIPE and right click it to access the GUI. You can only extract items from it. In order to insert items simply right click them on the drawer controller. 

You can find more complex tutorials on youtube for autocrafting.

questDatabase.name: Extrude all the things
questDatabase.description:
Now you hit the MV tier and it's time to get a better ratio when making sticks, pipes, wires, plates and many more parts. Most recipes use more than 32 EU/t so better make an MV extruder. After crafting the machine you need some extruder shapes for the different types of parts you want to make.

Most of the Tinkers Gregworks tool parts are made in the extruder.

questDatabase.name: Tool Forge
questDatabase.description: Finally you get your first alumite. Now it's time to craft a tool forge for making bigger Tinkers tools.

questDatabase.name: One Block mining is so Old School
questDatabase.description: By making a steel hammer you are now able to mine a shaft of 3x3 blocks. Be careful in the Nether or you could be boiled in lava very quickly.

questDatabase.name: Cutting a Tree log by log is so Old School
questDatabase.description: By making a steel lumber axe you are now able to cut down the entire tree in one hit. Don't forget your backpack when you are cutting a sacred oak tree down.

questDatabase.name: Mining Dirt Block by Block is so Old School
questDatabase.description: By making a steel excavator you are now able to mine dirt in a 3x3 area. Don't destroy your whole garden.

questDatabase.name: Glue
questDatabase.description: If you centrifuge sticky resin, you get some glue. Glue is very useful in the creation of good circuit boards.

questDatabase.name: Silicon
questDatabase.description: Due to the chip production, silicon becomes a more important material. You can centrifuge it out of fullers earth, asbestos or redstone dust. The electric blast furnace is needed to make ingots. One ingot requires a temperature of 1687 K for 84 seconds at 120 EU/t.

questDatabase.name: Diode
questDatabase.description: Good circuits need diodes. There are two ways to craft them. Using a silicon wafer together with some fine tin wire or gallium arsenide. Molten glass is also needed.

questDatabase.name: Empty Circuit Board
questDatabase.description: Good circuit boards require wooden pulp and refined glue to make phenolic circuit boards. By adding gold wire you can craft a good circuit board.

questDatabase.name: Are you Prepared for HV?
questDatabase.description:
Stainless steel will be the material for the HV Tier. There are two ways to process it. Mixing it by hand outputs 8 stainless steel dust.

Manganese can be found in ore veins together with grossular ore, spessartine ore, pyrolusite ore and tantalite ore.

Chrome can be centrifuged out of manganese dust and ruby dust.

questDatabase.name: Molten Plastic
questDatabase.description: Molten polyethylene can be made in a chemical reactor using ethylene, compressed air cells or oxygen - using oxygen gives a 50% boost. Use a mold for making plates in a fluid solidifier to make plastic sheets.

questDatabase.name: Mixing Stainless Steel
questDatabase.description:
Stainless steel will be the material for the HV Tier. There are two ways to process it. Mixing it in a mixer outputs 9 stainless steel dust each process.

Manganese can be found in ore veins together with grossular ore, spessartine ore, pyrolusite ore and tantalite ore.

Chrome can be centrifuged out of manganese dust and ruby dust.

questDatabase.name: Silicon Plate
questDatabase.description: Advanced circuits require transistors, which are made out of silicon plates, fine tin wire and molten polyethylene.

questDatabase.name: Stainless Steel EBF processing
questDatabase.description:
Stainless steel ingots are made in the electric blast furnace at a temperature of 1700K. 
It takes 80 seconds at 480 EU/t or by adding oxygen gas 60 seconds at 480 EU/t.

You need a miniumum of two MV energy hatches to power the EBF.

questDatabase.name: MV Energy Hatch
questDatabase.description: Some materials like stainless steel require 480 EU/t. Your LV hatches are not good enough. Craft a minimum of two MV hatches to upgrade your electric blast furnace to HV.

questDatabase.name: Better than Duct Tape
questDatabase.description:
A soldering iron tool to remove the "burned out circuits" message is better than duct tape. 
The soldering iron requires one soldering material item and 10,000 EU. Valid soldering materials are fine wires, rods, and ingots made from either tin, lead, or soldering alloy. The soldering iron will consume the first such material it finds in the player's inventory.

For the other problems other tools are necessary.

Possible problems                  Tool to fix
"Pipe is loose."                        Wrench
"Screws are missing."             Screwdriver 
"Something is stuck."               Soft mallet 
"Platings are dented."              Hammer 
"Circuitry burned out."          Soldering Iron 
"That doesn't belong there."     Crowbar

questDatabase.name: Less Power loss
questDatabase.description: When you reach MV tier you can make your own duct tape in case you have to move your multiblock machines around. Duct tape will fix all maintenance problems in any multiblock machine.

questDatabase.name: Ruby Electrolyzing
questDatabase.description: Ruby is a good source for electrolyzing to get chrome and aluminium.  Your new MV electrolyzer gives you access to a lot of new recipes. Once you get low on Ruby, you can centrifuge Redstone to get more.

questDatabase.name: MV Batteries
questDatabase.description: Better machines need some better batteries. Let's make some MV battery hulls for new batteries. Now it's up to you to make lithium, cadmium, sodium or acid batteries with these hulls.

questDatabase.name: Molten Polyethylene
questDatabase.description:
Polyethylene is made out of ethylene in a chemical reactor.
Tip: Right-clicking an empty cell on a fluid tank will fill the cell with fluid from that tank. 
Tip: If you want to extract multiples of 144 into a portable tank, you can use a smeltery faucet. Whack it on and back off, and it will send exactly 144.

questDatabase.name: Clay Electrolyzing
questDatabase.description: You found out that electrolyzing clay dust will give you silicon dust. There are plenty of stained clay blocks found in canyon biomes or on mountains that can be pulverized to clay dust.

questDatabase.name: Powderbarrels
questDatabase.description: Powderbarrels are twice as good as dynamite in the implosion compressor. Craft one stack.

questDatabase.name: TNT
questDatabase.description:
TNT is much more powerful than the powderbarrel but much harder to craft. There are LV and HV ways to craft. At LV you need heavy or light fuel to make some toluene which can be solidified to gelled toluene. Alternatively you can use sugar and plastic dust in a chemical reactor to make toluene more efficiently. Mix it with sulfuric acid to make TNT.

The HV way requires an oil cracking unit to make all kinds of cracked fuel or cracked naphta and a distillation tower to extract toluene from that.

questDatabase.name: iTNT
questDatabase.description: Industrial TNT is the HV variant of TNT. It explodes with more power, yet does not destroy blocks when it explodes.

questDatabase.name: Dynamite
questDatabase.description:
Dynamite is the most basic explosive you can use in the implosion compressor.
Mix some paper, string and glyceryl trinitrate in a chemical reactor to get dynamite.

questDatabase.name: Time to oil drill!
questDatabase.description:
Pumps are nice but you're going to reach a point where you will want MOOOOOOOOOOOOORE oil. This multiblock will help with that but you will need to search for oil using a seismic prospector. You can find raw, light and heavy oil. There's also a chance to find natural gas.

Higher tiers of power will drill faster. You need to upgrade the energy hatch corresponding to the power tier. 

Later you can upgrade the oil drilling rig so it extracts from more than one chunk at a time.

You need mining pipes in the machine block.

questDatabase.name: Let's get it crackin!
questDatabase.description:
Cracking oil will result in better by-products in the distillation tower. It is a smart idea to get this multiblock since you are going to need TONS of industrial TNT for advanced tier rockets. 

If you add steam the amout of EU/t will be reduced by 50% and if you add hydrogen the output will be increased by 30%.

Hint: Only GT/Railcraft steam can used no ic2 steam.

questDatabase.name: Analyzing the soil
questDatabase.description:
To determine which kind of oil or gas there is in the chunk you need to scan the soil by right clicking a Seismic Prospector with 8 dynamite, 4 TNT, 2 industrial TNT or 1 glyceryl. Then use a data stick to extract the data by right clicking on it after the animation has finished.
Now you need to add the analyzed data stick to a scanner. Then place it in the bottom right slot of the printer and add 3 paper in the top left slot and make sure you have atleast 144 mb squid ink in it. (Only gregtech machines will work)

After the process is done take the printed page and combine it with a piece of leather in an assembling machine filled with at least 20 mb of refined glue. Don't assemble more than one book at time.

TADA now you have a book with info about the chunk you scanned.

Note: Each oilfield is 8x8 chunks. Within the field the amount can vary +- 25 percent. The amount reported in the book is the oil extracted per tick from that chunk.  The total amount in the chunk is complicated.

questDatabase.name: You smell like a distillery!
questDatabase.description:
This bad boy will tremendously boost the by-products of your cracked fuel or pyrolyse oven. This way you can make industrial TNT, polyethylene, polytetrafluoroethylene and other plastics more efficiently. 

You will also need this for your automated setups.

questDatabase.name: Playing with dust
questDatabase.description: This machine will help you turn dust into crystals which you will need for high tier recipes.

questDatabase.name: Avengers, Assemble! 2
questDatabase.description: You know what this does. :D

questDatabase.name: Dust to crystals
questDatabase.description: Use the autoclave to crystallize your dust. You can make raw carbon mesh out of carbon dust.

questDatabase.name: Precision is required
questDatabase.description: You will use this a lot to make high tier circuits, and for other recipes

questDatabase.name: Way one: Raw carbon mesh
questDatabase.description: This way of making carbon requires autoclaving 4 carbon dust. You can use polyethylene which gives you only 1 raw carbon fibre at LV tier, polytetrafluoroethylene gives you 2 at MV Tier or go for the best way: molten epoxid which yields 4 at HV Tier.

questDatabase.name: Way two: Bio Organic Mesh
questDatabase.description:
If want to save the ecosystem you can autoclave 16 plantballs to get raw bio fiber with the following liquids:

-Biomass 33% chance
-Methanol 50% chance
-Fuel 90% chance
-Nitro-diesel 100% chance

However, making carbon plates this way will require an electric blast furnace.

questDatabase.name: Carbon parts
questDatabase.description: These are the first parts you will need for your beloved nano armor.

questDatabase.name: Seeing things brighter
questDatabase.description: The nano helmet is a bit special. It will provide you with night vision as long as you have energy!  Don't turn it on in bright areas or you'll be blinded!

questDatabase.name: Are those green diamonds?
questDatabase.description: They may not be green diamonds but they are needed for your nano armor.

questDatabase.name: Carbon Plates
questDatabase.description: Carbon plates are needed for the nano armor. Go check out the armor chapter.

questDatabase.name: Carbon skin
questDatabase.description: You can stop worrying about some mobs for now. This will help you survive a bit and will give you some of that SWAG. Your journey doesn't stop here traveller, as quantum armor awaits you!

questDatabase.name: Organic Way
questDatabase.description: Bio carbon plates are made out of raw carbon mesh. Put it in the electric blast furnace to make carbon plates.

questDatabase.name: Still not enough charcoal?
questDatabase.description:
This oven is the best way to get charcoal and creosote (x50 faster than Railcraft's coke oven) and other byproducts. You will need tons of bronze, iron and steel to build it, but it's worth it. Finally, it will be possible to dismantle the charcoal pit.
With Cupronickel coils the oven is a bit slower. Each coil tier speeds up the charcoal production.

questDatabase.name: Monocrystalline Silicon
questDatabase.description: To make wafers, you need to make monocrystalline silicon first. The process takes 450 seconds and requires silicon dust and gallium arsenide dust in the electric blast furnace. You can make 16 wafers out of every boule.

questDatabase.name: We need big toys
questDatabase.description: All your little turbines take up too much space? Are you running out of water? It is time to solve these problems. This large turbine can help you produce a tremendous amount of energy. It will also distill water for you, so you can use the same water again inside your large boiler.  Don't forget to make a rotor for the turbine. At the initial stage the most suitable materials for the rotor are: vanadium steel (it has a very high durability, but slowly produces energy), cobalt (good combination of durability and performance) and ultimet (has higher efficiency, durability and performance). Make sure you provide the optimal flow of steam using a fluid regulator. Don't exceed your dynamo hatch's EU rating, or it will explode!

questDatabase.name: It's time to get more steam
questDatabase.description:
As soon as you have the ability to store energy in large quantities, it would be necessary to have a way to generate energy in large quantities. You need a large bronze boiler. But in order to make this boiler, you will need a mountain of bronze. This boiler produces 800 liters of steam per tick. This is enough to run 10 basic steam turbines.

The large boiler can use either water or distilled water. Water is consumed at a rate of 1L of water per 150L of steam.

To make a large boiler you must make a 3x3x5 structure with Bronze Pipe Casings in the center of the middle 3 levels. The lowest level must contain at least 1 or 2 input hatches, 1 or 2 input buses, 3 or 4 fireboxes, 1 muffler, and one maintenance hatch. The lowest level can not contain any plated bricks. All hatches, buses, and mufflers must have their back side touching a firebox. The output hatch can be placed on any of the upper 4 levels.

questDatabase.name: Transistor
questDatabase.description: For the next tier we need advanced circuits. To create some advanced circuits, you need some transistors.

questDatabase.name: Steam is never enough
questDatabase.description: Now you can make advanced circuits, which means it's time to build a large steel boiler. This boiler is one and a half times more efficient than a bronze one, and that means we need 5 more steam turbines. Don't forget to monitor the water level!

questDatabase.name: Moooooore steam
questDatabase.description: Stock up on titanium, it will be fun. A large titanium boiler produces 1600 litres of steam per tick. For this amount you need to choose the right rotors for your turbines. For example, 2 normal cobalt rotors will be just right. Optimal flow for such rotor is 800 liters per tick. Make a fluid regulator in the assembler to control the flow rate. If you have more than one boiler, you will need to make calculations in order to select the appropriate rotors. Make sure your dynamo hatch is capable of accepting all the EU, or it will explode!

questDatabase.name: Even more steam? Are you sure?
questDatabase.description: This boiler is the most efficient source of steam. It allows you to produce as much as 2000 litres of steam per tick. If you need more, then build a dual or even quad boiler.

questDatabase.name: Energy Crystals
questDatabase.description: Make energy crystals out of ruby and redstone dusts in the MV mixer. Energy crystals can store 1 million EU and work as an HV battery.

questDatabase.name: Nano Crystal
questDatabase.description: Nano crystals are used for making the nano armor.

questDatabase.name: MV Precision Laser
questDatabase.description: Advanced circuits need an MV precision laser. Let's craft one.

questDatabase.name: Silicon Wafer
questDatabase.description: To create some silicon wafers, put the monocrystalline silicon boule in a cutting machine. It would be better to immediately make the MV version because you will need it later for RAM, IC's and other chips.

questDatabase.name: Good Integrated Circuits
questDatabase.description: Good circuits have three variants. For the advanced circuits you need the good integrated circuits.

questDatabase.name: Integrated Circuit
questDatabase.description: There are two variants of basic circuits. The basic circuit from IC2 or the integrated circuit which needs a circuit assembling machine to be made. The good integrated circuit needs two integrated circuits to be crafted.

questDatabase.name: Basic Circuit Assembler
questDatabase.description: Advanced circuits require an LV circuit assembling machine. Basic ones can be made much more efficient with this machine. Let's craft one.

questDatabase.name: Sensor lens
questDatabase.description: The night vision goggles need special sensor lenses to work.

questDatabase.name: Advanced Heat Exchanger
questDatabase.description: The night vision goggles need advanced heat exchangers to work.

questDatabase.name: Copper capped Greatwood Wand
questDatabase.description:
Making a gold capped greatwood wand requires 35 vis, but your old wand's limit is 25. So first create an iron or copper capped greatwood wand and then create a gold capped greatwood wand.
Make sure you use NEI 'U' command on the wand caps to find the correct GT:NH recipe for the wand.

questDatabase.name: Don't try to dive with it
questDatabase.description: Combining a scuba helmet with a nano helmet in an assembling machine will give you a nano scuba helmet. You'd better not try to dive with it because you can't. It is a part of the new quantum suit helmet.

questDatabase.name: Plated Leggings better not try to wear it
questDatabase.description: Combining stainless steel platings with some nano leggings in the assembler gives you nano plated leggings. Better not try to wear them because you can't. They are part of the new quantum suit leggings.

questDatabase.name: Don't try to walk with it
questDatabase.description: Combining some rubber boots with nano boots in the Assembler gives you Nano Rubber Boots. Better not try to put them on because you can't. They are part of the new quantum suit boots.

questDatabase.name: Iridium Plated
questDatabase.description: Plating all your armor parts with iridium alloy casings gives them a better durability. Before you can wear these quantum armor parts you need to activate them with some quantum crystals.

questDatabase.name: Quantum Armor
questDatabase.description: The quantum armor is a high tier and very durable armor with a lot of features like night vision, fall damage reduction and running very fast.

questDatabase.name: Quantum crystal
questDatabase.description: The quantum crystal is needed to turn quantum armor parts into wearable quantum armor.

questDatabase.name: Lapotron Dust
questDatabase.description: Lapotron crystals require you to mix your energium dust with some lapis dust.

questDatabase.name: Lapotron Crystal
questDatabase.description:
With your new HV mixer you can make lapotron dust. Place it in an autoclave to make some raw lapotron crystals. With an EV assembler and advanced circuits you can make lapotron crystals which store up to 10 million EU.

Hint: Nei shows only ic2 advanced circuits in recipe but all advanced circuits works.

questDatabase.name: Quantum Crystal
questDatabase.description: For your quantum armor you need some quantum crystals. Place a lapotron crystal in your precision laser to get a quantum crystal

questDatabase.name: Mixing at HV Level
questDatabase.description: High Tier dusts need HV Mixer.

questDatabase.name: NASA Workbench aka Dire Crafting Table
questDatabase.description: The Avaritia 9x9 dire crafting table replaces the NASA workbench. It is required to craft all rockets and high tier equipment. First of all you need 81 crafting tables to make a double compressed crafting table, a few HV components, wafers and a crystal matrix. And yes, you do need nether stars. Hint: Check out the nether star recipe which uses null catalyst and salis mundus. Null catalyst can be duplicated by adding magma cream, blaze powder and a tiny pile of nether star dust.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Tier 1
questDatabase.description: After hours of hard work and a few stacks of TNT your first rocket is finally ready. But before you can go to the Moon you need to craft a few more things.

questDatabase.name: Tier 1 Schematic
questDatabase.description: Each rocket needs a construction plan. You can craft the first one using a data circuit and a compressed steel plate in a hv circuit assembler.

questDatabase.name: Tier 1 Heavy Duty Plates
questDatabase.description: Rockets require heavy duty plates for the main hull. Let's craft 36 of these plates out of compressed aluminium plates, compressed bronze plates and compressed steel plates.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Nose Cone
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs a nose cone.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Fins
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs a few rocket fins.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Engine
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs a rocket engine. Better craft two, because the Moon lander needs one also.

questDatabase.name: Moon Lander
questDatabase.description:
The Moon lander is required for a soft landing.
You will need an additional frequency module for hearing things on planets and a second seat for a Moon buggy you may build later.

questDatabase.name: Buggy Seat
questDatabase.description: The buggy seat is part of the Moon lander and the Moon buggy.

questDatabase.name: Frequency Module
questDatabase.description: The frequency Module will help you hear sounds properly while in space (it's also used with the telemetry unit so that your buddies can keep track of you from your base, if you are playing with friends). You need it in your inventory and in the Moon lander.

questDatabase.name: Small Fuel Canister
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs fuel storage canisters. For the tier 1 rocket you need to craft two of them.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Launch Pad
questDatabase.description: Every rocket needs a 404launch pad.0 Build a 3x3 launch pad to place your rocket.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Fuel
questDatabase.description: To pump fuel into your rocket you need a fuel loader. Place it right next to the middle of any side of the launch pad.

questDatabase.name: Oxygen Gear
questDatabase.description: Oxygen gear is used to attach oxygen tanks to the oxygen mask. This is absolutely vital for any astronaut.

questDatabase.name: Oxygen Mask
questDatabase.description: The oxygen mask is part of the system used to breathe on planets without oxygen, the others being oxygen gear and oxygen tanks.

questDatabase.name: Oxygen Tanks
questDatabase.description:
The Light oxygen tank is an oxygen storage tank that can hold up to 900 units of air. It is used to provide a portable source of oxygen while in areas that do not have an oxygen source of their own.

Usage:
Up to two oxygen tanks can be worn at a time. To wear any type of oxygen tank, open your inventory and click on the Galacticraft tab at the top of the menu. Here you will see the available spots for your various types of equipment. Simply place your tank(s) in one of the slots with a grey picture of an oxygen tank. Other types of oxygen tanks are the medium oxygen tank, which holds twice the amount of oxygen as a light tank, and the heavy oxygen tank, which holds three times the amount of a light tank. I recommend making the medium tanks and using the light tanks as spares to return to base.

questDatabase.name: Copper Ore
questDatabase.description:
Can be found between y levels 5 and 60 either as "Copper Ore" or "Chalcopyrite". Most of the time you'll find it together with  "Iron" and "Pyrite".

Hint:
To see where a special ore can be found click the raw ore in NEI and it will show you more details. Works with small ores too.

questDatabase.name: Iron Ore
questDatabase.description:
With iron tools, you are able to mine most of the Overworld ores. I think you already found iron or magnetite. So bring me some ores and make some iron ingots out of them.

Hint:
To see where a special ore can be found click the raw ore in nei and it will show you more details. Works with small ores too.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Fuel
questDatabase.description: For every flight the rocket needs some fuel. So refine some fuel and fill some fuel canisters.

questDatabase.name: Oxygen Collector
questDatabase.description: The oxygen collector is a block that gathers oxygen from leaves and farm plants to use in an oxygen bubble distributor, oxygen sealer, oxygen compressor, and other oxygen-reliant machines. If you plan to build a Moon base, which needs a continuous oxygen supply, you will need to build one.

questDatabase.name: Oxygen Compressor
questDatabase.description: The oxygen compressor is used to fill empty or depleted oxygen tanks. Connect an oxygen pipe to the blue ring input side and a power source to the grey square input side. Place an oxygen tank in the bottom right slot and it will take oxygen from the input and place it into the tank.

questDatabase.name: Parachute
questDatabase.description:
A parachute is used to prevent death upon re-entry into the Overworld's atmosphere. The parachute is an essential part of your journey to space. You should never journey into space without it. There will even be a warning if you try to launch without one on you.

Use the assembler to save materials.

questDatabase.name: Advanced Wafers
questDatabase.description: The advanced wafer is used for more advanced machines such as the advanced solar panel or the Avaritia dire crafting table. It is also used in the creation of a space station.

questDatabase.name: Wafers
questDatabase.description: The basic wafer is used for creating basic machines such as the basic solar panel, the fuel loader, the energy storage module and the compressor.

questDatabase.name: Purge your warp
questDatabase.description: The warp you have accumulated over time is starting to become a problem. Making bath salts to clean off the warp is only a temporary solution. To truly get rid of it, you need something more powerful, a pure tear. If you collect a few things for me, I will give you one. Think wisely about using it, since it's a very long journey to unlock it through research.

questDatabase.name: Circuit Boards
questDatabase.description: For every circuit you need a basic circuit board. Craft a coated circuit board and use copper wire to finish it.

questDatabase.name: Resistor
questDatabase.description: Every basic circuit needs two resistors to work

questDatabase.name: Gallium Arsenide
questDatabase.description:
The diode requires gallium arsenide and you may be wondering how to get gallium or arsenic this early in the game.
You can get gallium out of crushed zinc ore by using a thermal centrifuge. You can find the small zinc ores in the Overworld or the in the Nether at Y Level 80 - 210. To get crushed ore, you may need a Tinker's Construct tool with the Luck (Fortune) enchant on it. Sphalerite is another source of gallium. Finally you can breed zinc bees, which have a small chance at gallium combs.
You can get arsenic from realgar small ores in the Nether at Y level 5 - 85. Centrifuge the dusts in a centrifuge. Another source is tinkers construct cobalt ore in the nether.
You need to level up your obsidian level tool or use a alumite tool.

Another nice way to get gallium and arsenic is with XP buckets in a crafting grid.

Mix those two dusts in a mixer to get gallium arsenic dust.

In the nether it is maybe easier to use a GT miner to get all the ores you need.

questDatabase.name: ILC and RAM
questDatabase.description:
Advanced circuits need integrated logic circuits and random access memory chips.
You can get those by cutting the ILC and RAM wafers.

questDatabase.name: Advanced Circuits
questDatabase.description: For the next tier we need advanced circuits. To make an advanced circuit, you need good integrated circuits, RAM, an integrated logic circuit, and transistors.

questDatabase.name: Handle tiny piles like a K1ng
questDatabase.description:
Don't you hate having to manually compress all those tiny piles ? Well, let me show you how to automate that. A combination of typefilter, chest buffer (or super buffer in HV) and packager frees you from that annoying task. The chestbuffer can hold up to 9 stacks of tiny piles and the super buffer can hold 256 stacks of tiny dusts, which is more than enough. You can set its mode with a screwdriver on the output side. Set it to 9 to export 9 tiny piles at a time and let the packager compress these into regular dusts.

Super buffers can be lag sources, so be careful to keep them as empty as possible. If you are using a multiblock packager, be sure to change the buffer from Stocking mode to Transfer Size mode.

questDatabase.name: Butane and Propane
questDatabase.description:
You can distill a lot of different gases out of your "refinery gases".
Methane, butane, propane, helium and ethane.

Hint:
Refinery gas is not the best source for Propane and Butane. Better refine those out of naphtha.

questDatabase.name: Tetranitromethane
questDatabase.description: Light fuel, bio diesel and diesel can be boosted by using tetranitromethane. Ethenone and nitric acid are required to make tetranitromethane in a chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: Methane Gas
questDatabase.description: Methane gas with a burn value of 104,000 EU per cell can be burned in the gas turbine.

questDatabase.name: Methanol
questDatabase.description: Methanol with a burn value of 84,000 EU per cell can be used to make biodiesel and other fluids.

questDatabase.name: Ethanol
questDatabase.description: Ethanol with a burn value of 192,000 EU per cell can be used to make biodiesel and other fluids.

questDatabase.name: Bio Diesel Fuel
questDatabase.description:
With ethanol or methanol and seed oil or fish oil you can make bio diesel. Burn value is 256,000 EU per cell. Diesel and bio diesel are needed for cetane-boosted diesel.

You get some glycerol as by-product. Save it so you can make glyceryl trinitrate for your dynamite or for your future epoxid production.

questDatabase.name: O like Oxygen
questDatabase.description: Oxygen can be made in different ways. Centrifuge some brown and yellow lemonite dust, or electrolyze it out of water or various other oxygen-rich elements.

questDatabase.name: Ethylene
questDatabase.description: You can make ethylene out of ethanol and sulfuric acid in a chemical reactor or by distilling various gases (i.e. wood gas) in a distillery. Cracking naptha, fuels and gas with hydrogen or steam in the chemical reactor will work too.

questDatabase.name: Seed Oil
questDatabase.description: To make some bio diesel you need seed oil or fish oil and mix that with ethanol or methanol. Seeds give seed oil and fish produce fish oil when placed in a fluid extractor.

questDatabase.name: Sodium Hydroxide
questDatabase.description:
Make some sodium hydroxide. You can make it out of sodium (or out of salt water once you reach EV).

The by-product hydrogen can be burned in a gas turbine.

questDatabase.name: Ethenone
questDatabase.description:
Hopefully you saved some sulfuric acid during your fuel production. Together with acetic acid you can make ethenone.
Craft an advanced chemical reactor to get access to more advanced recipes.

Save the ethenone for HV, you will need it to make tetranitromethane for cetane boosted diesel.

questDatabase.name: Nitric Acid
questDatabase.description: Nitric acid can be made out of water, oxygen and nitrogen dioxide.

questDatabase.name: Acetic Acid
questDatabase.description: Acetic acid can be made out of oxygen and ethylene. Alternatively, it can be made out of biomass, wood vinegar or vinegar.

questDatabase.name: Nitrogen Dioxide
questDatabase.description: To make nitrogen dioxide you need to combine oxygen gas and nitric oxide in a chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: Ammonia
questDatabase.description: Nitrogen and hydrogen... Ammonia.

questDatabase.name: Nitric Oxide
questDatabase.description: To make nitric oxide you need to combine oxygen and ammonia in a chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: 1,1-Dimetylhydrazine
questDatabase.description: To make 1,1-dimethylhydrazine you need to combine some dimethylamine and chloramine in a chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: Dimethylamine
questDatabase.description: Combining ammonia and methanol in a chemical reactor produces some dimethylamine.

questDatabase.name: Chloramine
questDatabase.description: Combining hypochlorous acid and ammonia in a chemical reactor produces some chloramine.

questDatabase.name: Hypochlorous Acid
questDatabase.description: Hypochlorous acid requires water, chlorine and some mercury.

questDatabase.name: Titanium finally
questDatabase.description:
Rutile, chlorine and carbon dust makes Titaniumtetrachloride. Combining this with Magnesium in an HV EBF will give you hot Titanium ingots. Freeze those and you will get your first titanium.
On the Moon if you are lucky you can find pure Titanium ore.

questDatabase.name: Tungstensteel
questDatabase.description: Tungstensteel is needed for the next tier. Tungsten can be found on Mars or in Moon stone dust. Mix that with some steel dust. Smelt it at 3000K (requires nichrome coils) in an electric blast furnace.

questDatabase.name: Your first bow
questDatabase.description:
Since vanilla bows are only craftable in the assembling machine and mobs do not drop them very often you have to make a Tinkers bow. Wood would be the best material for now.  So craft the bow limbs out of wood and the bow string out of strings. The arrow that has the most durability is bone, so craft the stick out of bone. It is much lighter but less durable than a regular arrow. Use a flint tip to make it repairable with flint.

You can repair your bow the same way as all the other Tinkers tools. Arrows can be regained by repairing them or picking them up from the floor.

questDatabase.name: Bronze javelin
questDatabase.description: The bronze javelin is a bit expensive and has only 7 throws, yet it is a good mid-range weapon. With one bronze ingot you can replenish your stack of javelins.

questDatabase.name: Your first flint throwing knife
questDatabase.description: Is the bone bow too expensive for your taste? Then make a flint throwing knife instead. You need flint and a stick to get 12 knives. The durability and the attack damage are very low but it still helps with killing mobs from a safe distance.

questDatabase.name: Monster trap
questDatabase.description: If you're lucky you spawned in a sand or rainforest biome and find some quicksand. Collect a stack of the stuff, dig a small ditch and fill it with the quicksand to protect your "dirt base" home. Just don't fall in!

questDatabase.name: The transcontinental railroad
questDatabase.description: All the different mining veins that have been found seem to be really far apart. One way to shorten the travel time is to create a railroad from your base to the different mines. Sadly this requires a large amount of both iron and creosote. Let's not forget to place the last symbolic rivet on one of your new train lines.

questDatabase.name: Lapis, Lazurite, Sodalite, Calcite
questDatabase.description:
In order to make your bricked blast furnace you need to find a lapis vine containing calcite.
You can find the vein in the overworld or the Twilight Forest at Y 20-50.

questDatabase.name: Gypsum
questDatabase.description: To make bricks for the blast furnace you need concrete and gypsum. Gypsum can be found in a vein together with basaltic and granitic mineral sand, and fullers earth. Y 50-60 and only in the overworld.

questDatabase.name: Sifting Machine
questDatabase.description:
You need flawless or exquisite diamonds, emeralds, rubies or other gems? Well then it's time for you to make a Sifting Machine.

You can find small Zinc ores (look in NEI) or you can search the Nether for Sphalerite.

You'll need either an Ore Washer or Simple Ore Washer since the Sifter only takes purified ores.

questDatabase.name: Smelt all the things...
questDatabase.description:
Smelting up to nine items at once? With a bit of steel you can make a railcraft Steam Oven. 2x2x2

Hint: All furnace recipes work just fine, but you cannot use it to make charcoal from wood.

questDatabase.name: Molds, molds, molds
questDatabase.description: After you can make steel and have a tinkers smelter you have to make molds. Molds can be used in the alloy smelter and the fluid solidifier. You need them to make vacuum tubes, ingots, gears and more.

questDatabase.name: Maple Syrup
questDatabase.description: You spent hours and hours to find some maple trees? Why not use your forest ranger coins to buy some syrup? Add some spruce saplings and plant some maple trees.

questDatabase.name: Seed Bags
questDatabase.description: Finding some special "pams harvest craft" seeds can be very difficult. With your farmer coins you can buy some seedbags.

questDatabase.name: Jetpack v.0.1 Alpha
questDatabase.description: Do you like flying? Ok then, make a slimy bouncepad and enjoy the good view.

questDatabase.name: Slime Island Journey
questDatabase.description:
Rubber trees are not the only source for raw rubber. Go and find a slimy island high in the sky. Slime balls and slime leaves give raw rubber too.
Make some slime tree farms beside your rubber farm.

questDatabase.name: Bring me my vat of polyethelyne!
questDatabase.description:
Tired of using small cells to process chemicals? Build a Large Chemical Reactor and you can just pipe in and out fluids. Or use the glorious large fluid cells to deliver and remove fluids from the hatches. 

Be careful, if the output hatches are full, the reactor will void any extra products!

Some of the old recipes can now be done simply in the LCR, btw.

The LCR also counts as a cleanroom for any cleanroom recipes.

You will also need:
1 Maintenance Hatch
1 Energy Hatch
1 Input Bus
5 Output Bus
5 Input Hatch
5 Output Hatch

questDatabase.name: Scepter with 75 vis capacity
questDatabase.description: A scepter is crafted from a wand core, a primal charm, three wand caps, a twilight forest monster mob drop, and some screws. Any sort of core or cap may be used, but the caps must match each other. A scepter cannot hold a focus, but holds 150% as much vis as a wand with the same core, and gives an additional 5% discount for costs, beyond any discounts from its caps or the user's worn equipment.

questDatabase.name: Magic Staff Core
questDatabase.description: A staff requires an extra step for crafting: Two (matching) wand cores must be combined with a primal charm, and crystal clusters to produce a staff core. (While the recipes are all similar, each type of staff core requires a separate research topic to be learned.)

questDatabase.name: Primal Charm
questDatabase.description:
With your new 50 vis wand you are able to make a Scepter which holds up to 75 vis.
First you need some primal charms which cost 50 vis to craft.

questDatabase.name: Witch
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. What's cooking?

questDatabase.name: Pigmen
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Do you want some bacon?

questDatabase.name: Blaze
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Let me warm you up a bit.

questDatabase.name: Magma Cube
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely, and bouncy.

questDatabase.name: Enderman
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Don't look me in the eyes!

questDatabase.name: Cave Spider
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Let me sing itsy-bitsy spider for you.

questDatabase.name: Ghast
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. At least you're not a big cry-baby?

questDatabase.name: A Wizard's Staff has a Knob on the End
questDatabase.description: Join the core with two wand caps, a twilight forest mob drop, and screws just as for making a wand. A staff cannot be used for crafting, but holds 250% as much vis as a corresponding wand. It can even serve as a backup weapon for melee. While it cannot receive weapon enchantments, its damage is decent, and it does not take damage with use (no durability bar).

questDatabase.name: Silverfish
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Let me be as annoying as possible.

questDatabase.name: Magma Cube
questDatabase.description: You feel lonely. Wanna bounce?

questDatabase.name: Better Tank... ULV Tank
questDatabase.description: Next step is to store 32 buckets in a tank. The ULV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, iron plates, tin plates, a clay pipe, and a water bucket.

questDatabase.name: Better Tank... LV Tank
questDatabase.description: Next step is to store 64 buckets in a tank. The LV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, iron plates, bronze plates, a huge clay pipe, and an LV pump.

questDatabase.name: Better Tank... MV Tank
questDatabase.description: Next step is to store 128 buckets in a tank. The MV Tank from Gt++ needs steel plates, darksteel plates, bronze plates, a bronze pipe and an LV pump.

questDatabase.name: You're gonna hate this #2 in MV too
questDatabase.description:
The second item you'll need a lot of in MV tier. When you want to get fluid out of tanks you'll need one. 

Hint: Goes pretty well with fluid pipes or GT machines, adjust with a screwdriver. It can also be upgraded further into a fluid regulator which allows precise control of fluid transfer speed.

questDatabase.name: Better Tank... HV Tank
questDatabase.description: Next step is to store 256 buckets in a tank. The HV Tank from Gt++ needs aluminium plates, darksteel plates, vacuum tubes, a steel pipe, and an MV pump.

questDatabase.name: You're gonna hate this #1 in MV too
questDatabase.description:
The first item you'll need a lot of in MV too. If you want to pull items out of chests or barrels you'll need one. 

Hint: Goes pretty well with item pipes or GT machines, adjust with a screwdriver.
