questDatabase.name: You're gonna hate this #3 in MV too
questDatabase.description: An electric piston for your MV machines. The third item you are going to craft a lot of in the future.

questDatabase.name: You're gonna hate this #4 in MV too
questDatabase.description:
The fourth item you'll need a lot of in MV, which is also a pain to craft. Arguably the most painful item ever. 

Hint: Works like a conveyor but can work with selected item slots. Adjust with a screwdriver.

questDatabase.name: Simple Ore Washer
questDatabase.description: Too lazy to make an ore washer, yet bored with your non-automatable cauldron? Then the simple washer is the machine for you! It work reasonably fast and uses 8eu max - make sure you don't provide too much voltage! Ok, so you do not get any byproducts, but who cares!

questDatabase.name: Paying the highest price
questDatabase.description: A tier 2 blood altar needs 8 runes placed around the altar. Your new altar can hold more blood.

questDatabase.name: Don't look it in the eyes!
questDatabase.description: Bad things may happen if this creature is allowed to stay alive. The ores in its cave are valuable anyway.

questDatabase.name: I don't even...
questDatabase.description: Ok so there is this maze. And there are... minotaurs. But what in the world is a minoshroom?

questDatabase.name: A big ugly snake
questDatabase.description: Required for your first wand and in general, an ugly creature.

questDatabase.name: Adventure time!
questDatabase.description: Stop him before he makes his wish at Prismos'!

questDatabase.name: Who you're gonna call?
questDatabase.description: Phantom Busters! Or wait... Ah whatever. They drop good armor by the way.

questDatabase.name: The big fluffy crybaby
questDatabase.description: It flies, it makes funny sounds, and .. IT'S SO FLUFFY! Well, kill it.

questDatabase.name: Let her go
questDatabase.description: It seems the cold doesn't bother her. Committed crimes: None. But... you know... you have to progress somehow...

questDatabase.name: Yeti. Alpha, Yeti.
questDatabase.description: Wanted: Alpha Yeti. Death. Committed crimes: Violently throwing ice at people, for no reason.

questDatabase.name: Secret: A nice....
questDatabase.description: Hey, you! I want that lamp. I have something for you in return. You don't need it anyways, do you?

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Creeper)
questDatabase.description: Who hasn't experienced this... You think nothing evil, mine a few diamonds, and suddenly, you wake up in your bed, all your items gone. Time to strike back!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Pigman)
questDatabase.description: "Zombie Pigman"? What the hell is going on with you zombies! Maybe you should encase your animals better at night...

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Spiders)
questDatabase.description: Eeeek! Wall climbing monsters, gross! Slay them. Quickly! Watch out for the witch spiders, they can give as good as they get.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Skeleton)
questDatabase.description:
Arrows are nice, if you shoot them. If one hits you, well, bad things happen. 

Hint: Arrows are an excellent source of telum.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Blaze)
questDatabase.description: You should be careful with this task. Fire protection is highly recommended.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Zombie)
questDatabase.description: Nobody knows who they are, or where they came from. They're just annoying at night, and too stupid to make a crafting table.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Enderman)
questDatabase.description: Uh, fancy teleport pearls. You need them. All of them. Now!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Wither)
questDatabase.description:
After collecting a couple of those wither skeleton heads, you feel like you could use some more action. So why not kill a wither? You'll need a ton of nether stars anyway...

Kill it twice for something nice.

questDatabase.name: Secret: The trade for life
questDatabase.description: You have been busy my friend. I have something for you. Give me your hearts, and I will magically enhance them so you can actually use them.

questDatabase.name: Skeleton: Evolved
questDatabase.description: In order to advance to a higher tier and reach Mars, Deimos and Phobos, you need to make yourself a better rocket. There are rumors that an Evolved Skeleton hiding out on the Moon has schematics of such a device.

questDatabase.name: Creeper: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Not that regular creepers are nasty enough, no. There is an evolved creeper boss! He is your key (Well he HAS a key...) to reach the next tier of planets (Asteroid Belt, Ceres, Io, Europa, Ganymede, Callisto).

questDatabase.name: Blaze: Evolved
questDatabase.description: In order to proceed to Tier 4 Planets, the blaze boss needs to be killed. Find him in one of the dungeons on Ceres.

questDatabase.name: Ghast: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Fluffy, fluffier, ghasts! And also big crybabies. This one hides in a dungeon on IO, and holds the key for Tier 5 planets.

questDatabase.name: Crystal Boss: Ayyy.. Wait, what?
questDatabase.description: Seriously, a crystal boss? Anyway, it's your key to Tier 6 planets, and he lurks around on Enceladus.

questDatabase.name: Slime: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Totally looks like a thaumic slime to me. Don't you think so? Find this dude on Proteus.

questDatabase.name: Wolf:Evolved
questDatabase.description: The final frontier... A... wolf that is not even an Iron Maiden fan?... What did you expect, a super boss? Heh. No. Budget was too tight...

questDatabase.name: Technology: Evolved
questDatabase.description: You beat the game, literally. There is nothing left to do, you might want to try real life... But one thing might be interesting for you. You know, just for the phuns. Select one of the totally OP items here.

Lore:9: This! Is OP

questDatabase.name: Blood Altar Tier 3
questDatabase.description: To make your altar more powerful you need to upgrade it. You need to build pillars two block high out of blood-soaked thaumium block and on top one block of glowstone blocks on each pillar.

questDatabase.name: Blood Altar Tier 4
questDatabase.description: If you want to make tier 4 slates you need a Tier 4 altar. This can be made like the tier 3 altar with pillars out of void-blood-soaked stones four blocks high and a blood brick on top of the pillars.

questDatabase.name: Blood Altar Tier 5
questDatabase.description: If you want to make tier 5 slates you need a Tier 5 altar. This can be made with 4 beacons. Beacons have thaumcraft recipes and can be found in the thaumcraft book on the GTNH page.

questDatabase.name: Blood Altar Tier 6
questDatabase.description: The highest tier of the blood altar is tier 6. You need pillars of blood-soaked ichorium 7 blocks high and on top the crystal cluster blocks made out of demon soul shards.

questDatabase.name: Auto Mining
questDatabase.description: A miner in LV age? Wow! This nifty machine will find ores for you. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This machine needs 8 EU/t to work. The miner searches for ores in a 16 block radius. Don't forget to cover it up!

questDatabase.name: Auto Mining MV
questDatabase.description: The MV miner will find ores for you faster than the LV miner. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This miner need 128 eu to work. The Miner searches ores in a 24 block radius and works two times faster than the LV variant.

questDatabase.name: Auto Mining HV
questDatabase.description: The HV miner will find ores for you faster than the MV miner. Place up to two stacks of mining pipes in the right slots. This miner needs 512 eu to work. The Miner searches ores in a 32 block radius (two chunks) and works two times faster than the MV variant.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun
questDatabase.description:
Now its time to invest in some renewable energy. Let's start with solar panels. The basic one only gives 1 EU/t. Most gt machine can use them as covers. Be sure to put a glass layer above them in case it rains while you swap panels.

The Aluminium Iron plate need a mv forming press.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 8V
questDatabase.description: The next solar panel you can make is the ULV one. It generates 8 EU/t. Most gt machines can use them as covers.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 1x1
questDatabase.description: Put those single eu panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an MV assembler to combine the panel with a ULV hull.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun at LV Level
questDatabase.description: The next solar panel you can make is the LV one. It generates 32 EU/t max. Most gt machines can use them as covers. First you need to produce a sunnarium item by using 10 million eu power.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 1x1 LV
questDatabase.description: Put those 32 eu panel on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an MV assembler to combine the panel with an LV hull a battery and a robot arm. This pannel don't need to be cleaned manually.

questDatabase.name: Automated Sticky Resin Farmer
questDatabase.description: If you are tired of crafting tons of tree taps, how about a machine that uses power but never breaks? Let's craft an electric tree tap!

questDatabase.name: Automated Farmer
questDatabase.description: Your hoe must be getting worn out by now. Why not craft an electric one which never breaks?

questDatabase.name: Cleanroom
questDatabase.description:
If you want to make more advanced circuits you'll need a cleanroom. The cleanroom is a multiblock between 3x4x3 and 15x15x15 (WxHxD) blocks. Besides plascrete blocks for all edges you'll need a controller in the top center, filter machine casings for the rest of the top except edges, an energy and maintenance hatch , a reinforced door and three machine hulls. For now you can use MV tier.

Let's build a 5x5x5 room. Expanding it vertically is easy to do, or you can make it wider and longer, as long as both X and Z match and are odd.

questDatabase.name: A very useful Scanner
questDatabase.description:
The portable scanner is a tool capable of showing advanced information about almost every block in the game. 
In order to function, the tool needs to be charged first. It can hold up to 400k EU and accept 128 EU/t or less. This is MV tier.

It can scan crops, which shows more information than the cropnalyzer does. The crop, which was scanned in the world, will drop a scanned seed bag.
It can scan machines from GregTech, giving information about current progress, the stored energy, efficiency, problems and CPU-load - be sure to check the full chat window for additional details.
For any block in the game it scans, it gives information about its ID, Metadata, position in the world and hardness value.
It also gives information about pollution level in the chunk the scanned block belongs to.
In addition it shows when the cleanroom has reached its 100 percent efficieny level.

questDatabase.name: The Plunger
questDatabase.description:
The Plunger is used to clear liquids from pipes. It can also be used on a machine to remove up to 1000mb of fluid from its internal buffer. You don't have to wrench your machine and replace it. It can be crafted from a rod of the desired material and rubber sheets. 

Hint: Plunger deals 2.75 - 7.75 damage depending on the materials used.

questDatabase.name: Performing chemical experiments at HV Level
questDatabase.description: High tier chemical recipes like ammonia need an HV chemical reactor.

questDatabase.name: Super Tank I
questDatabase.description: Next step is to store 4000 buckets in a tank. The super tank I needs a hermetic casing made with aluminium plates and PTFE pipe. The tank need 4 circuits, a pulsating iron plate and an MV pump. Now you can store the same amount of fluids a steel 5x5 Railcraft tank contains in a single block.

questDatabase.name: Chad - A better way to make Paper
questDatabase.description: Making paper out of wood pulp and water can be tedious and difficult. Why not macerate some sugar cane down to chads and press it with two stone plates to paper? Later on you can use the chemical bath for a even better ratio.

questDatabase.name: Bamboo fence
questDatabase.description:
Maybe you are lucky and start off in a bamboo forest.
Bamboo is a very useful tree since it grows really fast and when you place bamboo sticks they will grow and protect your base behind a 3 block tall wall.
Alternatively, you can also use Berry Bushes.

questDatabase.name: Punji Sticks
questDatabase.description: A early game protection moat can be made out of punji sticks. It hurts all mobs/players and additionally gives a slowness II potion effect. Make a trench around your base and put the punji sticks inside.

questDatabase.name: Better than iron
questDatabase.description:
Wrought Iron will become more important very soon when you have a bit of steel and are able to build high pressure steam machines. The material is much harder than iron, and you can make better tools with it too.
To make wrought iron, you need a tinkers smelter to melt some iron ingots down and cast nuggets; put these in a furnace to get wrought iron nuggets. With the compressor, you can compress the nuggets into ingots.

Hint:
Crushed or purified ore can be smelted to iron nuggets directly. Later on, you can use an arc furnace to make wrought iron ingots directly.

questDatabase.name: Garden Bags
questDatabase.description: Finding some special "Pam's HarvestCraft" gardens can be very difficult. With your farmer coins you can buy some garden bags.

questDatabase.name: XP berries
questDatabase.description: And a few xp berries for cash.

questDatabase.name: Fluid Solidifier
questDatabase.description: Use molds to make plates, sticks, bolts and many more item parts in the fluid solidifier.

questDatabase.name: Base too big? I've got a fix for you!
questDatabase.description: Keeping a base spread apart for pollution or explosion prevention can really wear you out. Try harvesting some Marble and centrifuging it into Calcite, and mix up some concrete in your Mixer. Next output it into a Fluid Solidifier with a block mold to make concrete blocks. You'll move faster on top of these blocks. They can even be turned into bricks to prevent unwanted spawns! Hint: 10 buckets of wet mix converts to exactly 160 blocks. Note: Don't stack blocks more than 1 high or else you might move faster than you'd like. Or do it if you need to really get from point A to point B in a hurry. Also keep your animals off them. These blocks can also be Chiseled into different varieties.

questDatabase.name: Stainless Steel Pipes
questDatabase.description: Stainless steel pipes are much better than steel pipes. Like all high tier pipes (Titanium, Tungstensteel etc) you need a better wrench to deconstruct the pipes.

questDatabase.name: The "Water Problems" are solved
questDatabase.description: Entering the HV age you found a way of making a water reservoir which solves the finite water problem. Craft it with some fused quartz glass, HV pumps, and cauldrons.

questDatabase.name: Piston
questDatabase.description: Want some pistons? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Piston LV
questDatabase.description: Want some LV pistons? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Motor LV
questDatabase.description: Want some LV motors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Pump LV
questDatabase.description: Want some LV pumps? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Conveyor LV
questDatabase.description: Want some LV conveyor belts? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Robot Arm LV
questDatabase.description: Want some LV robot arms? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Sensor LV
questDatabase.description: Want some LV sensors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Emitter LV
questDatabase.description: Want some LV emitters? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Basic Circuit Board
questDatabase.description: Want some basic circuit boards? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Good Circuit Board
questDatabase.description: Want some good circuit boards? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Vacuum Tubes
questDatabase.description: Want some vacuum tubes? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Resistors
questDatabase.description: Want some resistors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Diodes
questDatabase.description: Want some diodes? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Wafers
questDatabase.description: Want some wafers? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Transistors
questDatabase.description: Want some transistors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Ram Wafer
questDatabase.description: Want some ram wafers? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Integrated Logic Circuit Wafer
questDatabase.description: Want some integrated logic circuit wafers? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Oil
questDatabase.description: Want some oil? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Creosote Oil
questDatabase.description: Want some creosote oil? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Diesel
questDatabase.description: Want some diesel? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Methane
questDatabase.description: Want some methane? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Bio Diesel
questDatabase.description: Want some bio diesel? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Oxygen
questDatabase.description: Want some oxygen? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Nitrogen
questDatabase.description: Want some nitrogen? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Hydrogen
questDatabase.description: Want some hydrogen? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Glue
questDatabase.description: Want some glue? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Lubricant
questDatabase.description: Want some lubricant? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Glycerol Cells
questDatabase.description: Want some glycerol? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Cetane-Boosted Fuel
questDatabase.description: Want some cetane-boosted fuel? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Silverwood Sapling
questDatabase.description: Silverwood saplings are always rare to find. Want some? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Ghast)
questDatabase.description:
They shoot you with explosive fireballs but they are weak when you hit them or knock the fireballs back with a weapon. Better upgrade your armor with fire and blast protection.

Sorry about the giant ghast Amancila, it can't be changed. 

You'll need to kill 10.

questDatabase.name: Is this the End? No the END Dimension
questDatabase.description:
Your investigation into the pearls has shown you that the source of the disturbance seems to be coming out of the shimmering portals inside strongholds. You feel strangely drawn into its mysterious depths.

Hint: throwing Ender Eyes in the air in the Overworld will guide you to the nearest stronghold . From time to time Ender Eyes are destroyed in this process, so make extras.

questDatabase.name: Upgraded RF Batteries
questDatabase.description: Capacitor Banks are upgraded RF batteries which can store the RF power you generate. You can put many blocks together to enlarge your total battery capacity.

questDatabase.name: Vibrant Capacitor Banks
questDatabase.description: The Vibrant Capacitor Bank is the largest RF Battery for now. It can store 25 million RF in a single block. Putting many capacitor banks together will enlarge your total battery capacity.

questDatabase.name: Vibrant alloy
questDatabase.description: Vibrant alloy is a high tier EnderIO alloy made out of ender eye, energetic alloy and chrome dust. 3600k heating coils and a vacuum freezer are needed to make ingots.

questDatabase.name: Energetic Alloy
questDatabase.description: Energetic alloy is a new alloy from EnderIO made out of gold, conductive iron and black steel dust. Double-layer capacitors need it and it can be made in the  electric blast furnace with tier 2 coils (2700K).

questDatabase.name: Dark Steel Armor basic upgrades
questDatabase.description: In order to upgrade one armor item with basic upgrades, you need a vibrant crystal and 10 xp levels.

questDatabase.name: Go find some tropical bees
questDatabase.description:
Next you will need to find some tropical bees. The hives can be found in Jungle biomes. Be careful as these bees are very aggressive and can poison you. Collect the silky combs and extract some silk wisp from those in order to make some Apiarist's clothes.
Looking for pristine Bees.

questDatabase.name: Silky combs and Propolis
questDatabase.description:
Collect silky combs and extract some silk wisp out of it in order to make some Apiarist's clothes.
This can take quite a bit of time.
Use a GregTech or Forestry Centrifuge to get Silky Propolis.

questDatabase.name: The Centrifuge
questDatabase.description: The Forestry Centrifuge is able to centrifuge up to 9 items out of bee combs. It uses RF energy.

questDatabase.name: Woven silk
questDatabase.description:
Centrifuge your silky propolis to get some silk wisp at a chance of 60%. Put 9 silk wisp in the Forestry carpenter or Gregtech assembler to get woven silk. 
This fine fabric can be used for crafting Apiarist's Clothes or to upgrade your Forestry Backpacks to 45 slots.

questDatabase.name: Apiarist's Cloth
questDatabase.description: If you have collected 24 woven silk you can make a complete Apiarist's suit to be protected from bee stings and other bad bee effects. You can also use the suit parts to upgrade your EnderIO Dark Steel Armor.

questDatabase.name: Dark Steel Armor advanced upgrades
questDatabase.description:
Your Dark Steel armor can be upgraded in various ways by combining it with various other items. You will need an anvil and a lot of XP.

Make sure when making the potions to only do three at a time, so the NBT data matches.

questDatabase.name: Dark Steel Tool and Weapon basic upgrades
questDatabase.description: In order to upgrade a weapon or tool, you need a vibrant crystal and 10 xp levels.

questDatabase.name: Dark Steel Tool and Weapon advanced upgrades
questDatabase.description: Your weapons and tools can be upgraded even more by adding capacitors and various other items.

questDatabase.name: RF Solar Panel
questDatabase.description: It is possible to power RF machines with a solar panel. It outputs 10 RF/t.

questDatabase.name: RF Solar Panel Tier 2
questDatabase.description: The upgraded RF solar panel is much better. It outputs 40 RF/t.

questDatabase.name: Enchanted Earth
questDatabase.description: Enchanted Earth makes saplings and seeds planted on it grow faster. When stacked on top of each other it has a chance to add ticks to the block above accumulating all the way to the top. This will randomly speed up growth a bit.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun at MV Level
questDatabase.description: The next solar panel you can make is the MV one. It gives 128 EU/t max. Most GT machines can use them as covers. First you need to produce sunnarium out of 9 smaller sunnarium pieces.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 1x1 MV
questDatabase.description: Put those 128 eu panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an HV assembler to combine the panel with an MV hull a battery and a robot arm. This panel don't need to be cleaned manually.

questDatabase.name: Indium
questDatabase.description:
At EV Level you are able to make Indium for HV Solar Panels. Indium cannot be found in Ore form. It can only be made with an EV chemical reactor.
First you need to make indium out of purified galena and sphalerite ore. Mix in some aluminium to get indium.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun at HV Level
questDatabase.description: The next solar panel you can make is the HV one. It generates 512 EU/t max. Most GregTech machines can use them as covers. First you need to produce enriched sunnarium by mixing irradiated uranium and sunnarium. The Avaritia 9x9 dire crafting table is required to make this panel.

questDatabase.name: Power of the Sun 1x1 HV
questDatabase.description: Put those 512 eu panels on a block to make them placeable in the world. Use an EV assembler to combine the panel with an HV hull a battery and a robot arm. This panel don't need to be cleaned manually.

questDatabase.name: Books
questDatabase.description:
Books can be found easily enough in villages or in the roguelike dungeons surface brick house.
I'm sure they have a recipe too.

questDatabase.name: Fish trapping 2.0
questDatabase.description:
Fishing can be very boring. Why not automate it with a fish trap?
This is your fish trap 2.0

questDatabase.name: Fresh Water and Milk
questDatabase.description:
Many cooking recipes need milk and water. Crafting it in the crafting table can be very tedious.
It is much easier using a Forestry worktable. Drag-click all your buckets into the worktable, and craft them all at once.

questDatabase.name: Find Bauxite
questDatabase.description:
The main goal when you reach the Moon is to find some bauxite ore to make titanium for the EV machine tier. Some meteoric iron is required for your tier 2 rocket for reaching Mars so be sure to collect a stack from fallen meteors and small ores beneath the surface.

If you are lucky you will find Titanium veins to make the process much easier.

questDatabase.name: Rutile
questDatabase.description:
Rutile can be thermal centrifuged out of bauxite and ilmenite dust. 
Electrolyzing bauxite can extract even more rutile and putting ilmenite in the electric blast furnace can give some rutile too.

questDatabase.name: SMD Circuit components
questDatabase.description: Surface-mount devices are more advanced circuits parts. They are needed for high tier circuits and are cheaper to craft than basic capacitors, transitors, diodes and resistors. You need an Advanced Assembler and some molten polyethylene.

questDatabase.name: Workstation Extreme Curcuit
questDatabase.description: The next tier of circuits are the extreme circuits. Workstation Circuits are the easiest one and are needed in EV Tier. Let's craft some.

questDatabase.name: Empty Plastic Board
questDatabase.description: Plastic circuit boards require plastic Plate with Sulfuric Acid to make an Empty Board. By adding copper foil and Iron(III) Chloride or Sodium Persulfate you can craft a plastic circuit board.

questDatabase.name: Integrated Processor
questDatabase.description:
There are three variants of good circuits. The good electronic circuit, the good integrated circuit and the integrated processor which needs an MV circuit assembling machine. The integrated processor requires a CPU, capacitors, transistors and resistors.
A cleanroom is needed.

questDatabase.name: Processor Assembly
questDatabase.description:
Another variant of the advanced circuit from IC2 is the processor assembly.
Two Integrated Processors are needed in the MV circuit assembler recipe.
The recipe is a cleanroom recipe.

questDatabase.name: Central Processing Unit
questDatabase.description:
Integrated Processors need central processing units. You can get these by cutting a ram wafer.
A cleanroom is needed.

questDatabase.name: Small Coil
questDatabase.description: Processing assembly needs some small coils.

questDatabase.name: Iron (III) Chloride
questDatabase.description:
Iron(III) Chloride can be made by first making hydrochloric acid out of hydrogen and chlorine. Then combine this with some iron dust to make Iron(III) Chloride.
You can etch your board with it.

questDatabase.name: Sodium Persulfate
questDatabase.description:
Sodium Persulfate can be made in the electrolyzer out of sodium bisulfate dust.
Sodium bisulfate is made out of sulfuric acid and salt in the chemical reactor.
You can etch your board with it.
Save the hydrochloric acid for your future epoxid production.

questDatabase.name: Motor MV
questDatabase.description: Want some MV motors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Conveyor MV
questDatabase.description: Want some MV conveyor belts? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Pump MV
questDatabase.description: Want some MV pumps? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Piston MV
questDatabase.description: Want some MV pistons? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Robot Arm MV
questDatabase.description: Want some MV robot arms? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Sensor MV
questDatabase.description: Want some MV sensors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Emitter MV
questDatabase.description: Want some MV emitters? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Motor HV
questDatabase.description: Want some HV motors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Conveyor HV
questDatabase.description: Want some HV conveyor belts? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Pump HV
questDatabase.description: Want some HV pumps? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Piston HV
questDatabase.description: Want some HV pistons? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Robot Arm HV
questDatabase.description: Want some HV robot arms? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Sensor HV
questDatabase.description: Want some HV sensors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Emitter HV
questDatabase.description: Want some HV emitters? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Plastic Circuit Board
questDatabase.description: Want some plastic circuit boards? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Central Procesing Unit Wafer
questDatabase.description: Want some central processing unit wafers? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Resistors SMD
questDatabase.description: Want some SMD resistors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Diodes SMD
questDatabase.description: Want some SMD diodes? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Transistors SMD
questDatabase.description: Want some SMD transistors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Capacitor SMD
questDatabase.description: Want some SMD capacitors? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Plastic Sheet
questDatabase.description: Want some Plastic Sheets? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Chlorine
questDatabase.description: Want some chlorine? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Iron (III) Chloride
questDatabase.description: Want some iron 3 chloride? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Sodium Persulfate
questDatabase.description: Want some sodium persulfate? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Pyrochlore Ore
questDatabase.description: Can't find Pyrochlore ore because of an old worldgen? Buy some Ores.

questDatabase.name: Forest Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Forest Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Deep Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Attuned Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Ender Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Ender Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Bees House
questDatabase.description: Want some bee houses? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Apiary
questDatabase.description: Want some Apiaries? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Proven Frames
questDatabase.description: Want some proven frames? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Infernal Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Infernal Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Oblivion Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Oblivion Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Did you want to know your warp level?
questDatabase.description:
After a few forbidden researches your warp level has increased a bit. Do you want to know how much warp you have?
Craft some litmus paper to print out the warp level.

questDatabase.name: Meadow Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Meadows Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Modest Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Modest Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Tropical Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Forest Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Wintry Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Wintry Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Marshy Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Marshy Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Water Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Water Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Rocky Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Rocky Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Nether Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Embittered Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Curious Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Mystical Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Unusual Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Unusual Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Resonating Hive
questDatabase.description: Want some Sorcerous Bees? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Space Station
questDatabase.description:
Here's an idea for your space station.
You can add up to four spin thrusters to your station to rotate it.

Days on space stations last longer than on the overworld, so you can generate more solar power.

questDatabase.name: Are you prepared?
questDatabase.description:
Are you prepared for the Moon?
A few things will help you to live longer and prevent you from dying on the Moon.
If you die on the moon you will be returned to earth without your stuff. A 2Soulbind0 enchantment will keep an item with you when you die.
Graves are placed at the location where you died.

questDatabase.name: Oak, Spruce, Birch, Jungle Sapling
questDatabase.description: You spawned in a desert and need Oak or Birch saplings? No problem! For five Forestry Coins you can select which one you want to buy.

questDatabase.name: Magic Feather
questDatabase.description:
Let's craft some magical Map focuses to create a magical map which will help you find Twilight Monster Bosses.
Go find some Raven feathers. You can get them by killing Ravens sitting on Obsidian Blocks in Twilight. Then you need some Torchberries and some Glowstone dust.

questDatabase.name: Magic Map
questDatabase.description: For the Magic map you need the magic map focus and a stack of paper. Please only use the map in the Twilight Forest. You can only get one map every 24 hours so be careful with it. Using the map in the Overworld or another dimension will lag the server.

questDatabase.name: Moon arrival
questDatabase.description:
I have a small present for you: a Talisman of Remedium which is very useful to persevere during the dark nights with all these monsters.
First you have to prove you can survive on the moon by yourself. After mining some moon turf, dirt, and rock, you can have it.

questDatabase.name: Naga
questDatabase.description: Summon a Naga in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Lich
questDatabase.description: Summon a Lich in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Minoshroom
questDatabase.description: Summon a Minoshroom in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Hydra
questDatabase.description: Summon a Hydra in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Knight Phantom
questDatabase.description: Summon a Knight Phantom in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Ur Ghast
questDatabase.description: Summon an Ur-Ghast in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Yeti
questDatabase.description: Summon a Yeti in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: Snow Queen
questDatabase.description: Summon a Snow Queen in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: MV Bending
questDatabase.description: This Plate Bending Machine allows you to directly make double, triple or more compressed plates, which might be useful for your first rocket in HV Tier.

questDatabase.name: MV Battery Buffers
questDatabase.description:
MV machines need battery buffers too. They come in different sizes like 1x, 4x, 9x and 16x.
Build a 1x and a 4x buffer.

questDatabase.name: MV Lithium Batterie
questDatabase.description: Better machines need some better batteries. Lithium is the best material to use when making batteries.

questDatabase.name: Lubricant
questDatabase.description:
Using lubricant instead of water or distilled water in your cutting machines will increase the output or speed of the machines.
You can make lubricant out of oil, seed oil, fish oil or creosote. If you are able to craft a brewery you can use talc and soapstone to get much more lubricant each cycle.

questDatabase.name: More Compact Storage
questDatabase.description: Now that you are starting to find more and more iron you feel your wood chests are too small to hold all the stuff you found and collected. Now it's time to upgrade your chests to iron chests. You can just build a new chest or upgrade the wood chest with a wood to iron chest upgrade item.

questDatabase.name: Juice
questDatabase.description: Most of your berries can be extracted to juice. This is a chance to get more food variants and the nutritional value is higher than eating the fruit directly.

questDatabase.name: Potato Cakes
questDatabase.description: Potatoes, onions, butter and a skillet make very tasty potato cakes.

questDatabase.name: Fried Eggs
questDatabase.description: So easy, skillet and an egg.... fried egg.

questDatabase.name: Hearty Breakfast
questDatabase.description:
Let's now combine all the things together and make a healthy and very good breakfast.
Some cooked meat, potato cakes, toast, fried egg and a tasty juice provide you with a very nourishing meal.
You can use any cooked meat and any fruit juice here.

questDatabase.name: Try to dry out the Nether
questDatabase.description:
Pumps can do more than pump oil and water. You can go to the nether and pump lava from the huge lava lakes too.
Don't forget to bring some tanks or fluid cells with you. Lava can be centrifuged for gold, silver, tin, copper, and a little tungstate.

questDatabase.name: Diamond Tanks... Oh shiny
questDatabase.description: After you build a cutting machine you can make some diamond plates for your new 64 buckets single block tank.

questDatabase.name: New source of Glowstone
questDatabase.description: Find some glowflowers in the Nether and plant them in the Overworld. You will never need to go to the Nether and harvest glowstone again.

questDatabase.name: Did you run low on Gold or Redstone?
questDatabase.description:
Did you run low on redstone and gold? No problem with your glowstone flower farm. You can centrifuge glowstone dust to redstone and gold dust.
Redstone is also a good source of aluminium and chrome.

questDatabase.name: Diamond Chests... Oh shiny
questDatabase.description: After you build a cutting machine you can make some diamond plates for your new big diamond chests.

questDatabase.name: Even More Compact Storage
questDatabase.description: If you found enough gold you can upgrade your chest to make it an even bigger inventory of 9x9. You can just build a new chest or upgrade the iron chest with a wood to gold chest upgrade item. You can use an assembler to make them a little easier.

questDatabase.name: Scribing Tool
questDatabase.description: To unlock your researches you need a scribing tool and paper. Better make two of them. One for your research table and one for researches. You also need some paper and ink.

questDatabase.name: Bathing the warp effects away.
questDatabase.description: Litmus paper tell you how high you warp level is, but how can you get rid of the nasty warp effects? Bath salt will help you by prohibiting warp effects for a short period. Just throw the salt into a 1x1 water hole and jump inside. You will feel relieved a bit after bathing.

questDatabase.name: Bathing in a Spa. Automated Warp removing
questDatabase.description: Bathing in a spa will automate the process of temporary removing warp effects. Take the bath salt with you into the spa.

questDatabase.name: Temp warp remover Soap
questDatabase.description:
This soap is very special. It will remove temporary warp and has a small chance to also remove some normal warp, if you are lucky. Taking a bath first increases your chances.

Hint: You need to chisel your tallow block for the recipe to work.

questDatabase.name: Enchanting Table 1.0
questDatabase.description: Finally with your new wand and 50 stored vis you are able to build your own enchantment table. The recipe can be found on the GTNH Thaumcraft Page

questDatabase.name: Division Sigil
questDatabase.description:
Maybe you found a division sigil in a chest already. You have heard about some ritual to activate it.

You need an enchantment table, 8 redstone dust, a good sword and an animal you want to sacrifice at night. Catching and holding it with a lasso would be the easiest way.
Place your enchantment table on a grass field and surround it with redstone dust.
Precisely at midnight place the animal on or near the table and kill it.
Of course you also need to have your sigil on you.
Be aware! Your actions will have consequences.

questDatabase.name: Beacon
questDatabase.description: With your new wand you are able to create a beacon. The beacon recipe is found on the GTNH Thaumcraft Page. Activate it in your base to gain various positive effects.

questDatabase.name: Cursed Earth
questDatabase.description: Kill the monsters that spawn on the cursed earth. Use a shovel with the silk touch enchantment to dig up the cursed earth blocks. You will need these blocks for your mob spawner later.

questDatabase.name: Silky Jewel
questDatabase.description:
It's time to craft some silky jewels for your tinkers tools. Lots of blocks you can easily grab with this tool.

The recipe can be found on the GTNH page after researching the enchantment table.

questDatabase.name: Division Sigil Stable
questDatabase.description:
The second ritual will not be as easy as the first one. After this ritual your sigil will be stable enough to make stable unstable ingots which will not explode.

This ritual needs to be performed in The End dimension. 
The ritual is performed by placing a Beacon in the centre of a flat area of at least 1111, not necessarily End Stone. Then place a chest in each of the cardinal directions leaving 4 spaces empty between the chest and the Beacon. In each chest insert these specific contents:

North: iron ingot, gold ingot and the other things listed in the task.
South: The different Ore Blocks and the other things listed in the task.
East: The potions.
West: The Music disks.

A spiral pattern of Redstone and String is then laid out around the beacon. At any time, Shift+Right-clicking the Beacon with an Activated Division Sigil in hand will show the building progress of the ritual.

Finally, kill an Iron Golem while it stands within the ritual area to activate the process. If it works, there will be an explosion that destroys the beacon and chests, while every Enderman in the End vanishes. During the ritual, throngs of aggresive mobs imbued with Haste will begin spawning and attacking the Player who needs to kill 100 of them to complete the ritual. If the Player dies or leaves the dimension, the ritual will fail and will have to be started over. Once enough mobs have been killed, the first activated Sigil in the inventory will stabilize. The Pseudo-Inversion Sigil can be used an unlimited number of times, and dividing an Iron Ingot by Diamond will produce Mobius "Unstable-Stable" Ingot which does not explode, can be produced in any crafting interface and will stack up to 64.

questDatabase.name: Blub blub blub.....
questDatabase.description:
The brewing stand is really important for brewing the various potions like night vision, healing, haste and jump. Toxic potions or splash potions can be created too. 
With your basic wand you can create one.

The recipes can be found on the GTNH page in the Thaumonomicon.

questDatabase.name: The Iron Guy
questDatabase.description:
Do you feel lonely? Need some extra protection in your base? Want to keep the pigmen off your back in the Nether?
Craft some Iron Golems and the monster problem inside your base will be gone.

questDatabase.name: The Cool Guy
questDatabase.description:
Feeling lonely? Located far away from a smow biome?
Craft a Snow Golem, and perhaps challenge him to a snow ball fight.

questDatabase.name: Oh crunchy
questDatabase.description: After hours of doing Thaumcraft research you found a way to craft pure tears. Ichorium purifies the nether star which sucks all the warp away. Be careful, as this may have a deadly end.

questDatabase.name: Purge all your warp
questDatabase.description:
Did you ever have a dream where you could purge all your warp with no bad side effects? This purification talisman will let your dreams come true.
Do not forget to wear it.

questDatabase.name: A Chest for Bees
questDatabase.description: A chest for bees only. It can hold up to 125 different bees in one chest.

questDatabase.name: Frames
questDatabase.description:
Untreated frames are the simplest frames. They do not work in bee houses, only in apiaries.
They increase the bee's performance. Each untreated frame will double a bee's productivity.

questDatabase.name: Impregnated Frames
questDatabase.description:
Impregnated Frames are even better than untreated Frames. 
Each frame doubles the bee's productivity. It has a longer durability than the untreated frame, but a shorter one compared to the proven frame.

questDatabase.name: Proven Frame
questDatabase.description:
Proven frames are much better than impregnated ones.
Each frame doubles the bee's productivity. Out of the three Forestry frames (Untreated, Impregnated and Proven), the proven frame has the longest durability.

You can make them or purchase them from a villager.

questDatabase.name: Go find some tropical bees
questDatabase.description: Next you will need to find some tropical bees. The hives can be found in Jungle biomes. Be careful as these bees are very aggressive and can poison you. Collect the silky combs and extract some silk wisp from those in order to make some Apiarist's clothes.

questDatabase.name: Breed some cultivated bees
questDatabase.description:
Common Princess and Foresty Drone can be bred to cultivated bees. 

Cultivated Bees produce Honey Combs every 0.9 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time.

Look for pristine bees.

questDatabase.name: Breed some common bees
questDatabase.description:
To cross breed bees you need two different species of bees. One drone and one princess from different hives (Meadows and Forestry as an example)
In an Apiary you can cross breed them to a new species.

Common Bees produce Honey Combs every 2.2 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time.

Look for pristine bees.

questDatabase.name: Breed some noble bees
questDatabase.description:
Cross breeding common and cultivated bees can result in noble bees. 

Noble bees produce dripping combs every 3.8 minutes and honeydew. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time. 

Look for pristine bees.

questDatabase.name: Dripping Combs
questDatabase.description:
Your noble bees produce some dripping combs.
A good source for honeydew, honey and for proven frames.

questDatabase.name: Breed some majestic bees
questDatabase.description:
Cross breeding noble and cultivated bees can result in majestic bees.

Majestic bees produce dripping combs every 1.5 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time.

Look for pristine bees.

questDatabase.name: Breed some imperial bees
questDatabase.description:
Cross breeding noble and majestic bees can result in imperial bees.

Imperial bees produce dripping combs every 3.8 minutes and royal jelly every 5.1 minutes. Note that production times are an approximation based on the bee's base production speed and the product's rarity. They do not reflect actual production time. Royal jelly is needed in making scented paneling for an Alveary.

Look for pristine bees.

questDatabase.name: Royal Jelly
questDatabase.description: Royal jelly is a honey bee secretion that is used in the nutrition of larvae, as well as adult queens. It is only produced by the imperial bee. It's production can be increased with proven frames or any other kind of frames except for the soul frame. Royal jelly is also useful because it can craft ambrosia, which fills 8 hunger points (4 full food icons) and gives Regeneration I for 40 seconds. Royal jelly is used to craft scented paneling which are required in the creation of alveary blocks.

questDatabase.name: Alvearies
questDatabase.description:
The alveary is an advanced variant of the apiary. The alveary allows for combs to be produced faster due to its natural speed increase to production (as well as the ability to add up to six frames via the Extra Bees frame housings) and due to its ability to be modified by other blocks. 
It is possible to adjust the internal temperature of the alveary using the alveary heater or alveary fan in order to accommodate bees that require hotter or colder climates.
 It is also possible to use mutators to increase chances of mutation, alveary lighting and alveary rain shield to allow bees without the nocturnal and tolerant flyer traits to work during the night and rain, respectively, and the swarmer to use excess royal jelly to create princesses that last for a limited number of generations.

A submission station is recommended for quests with large amounts of items.

questDatabase.name: Barrel Upgrades
questDatabase.description:
Are your cobblestone or dirt barrels filled to the brim? 
No problem, upgrade them!

questDatabase.name: Barrel Upgrades Tier 2
questDatabase.description:
Are your upgraded cobblestone or dirt barrels full again? 
No problem, upgrade them some more!

questDatabase.name: Alumite
questDatabase.description: It's upgrade time again. You can make alumite like modpack Moron by mixing obsidian, steel and alumin(i)um in the smeltery, or you can be a GregTech hero and search NEI for an alternate recipe using dusts. Alumite pickaxes are able to mine ardite and cobalt in the Nether.

questDatabase.name: Reinforced X? Unbreakable
questDatabase.description:
With your steel tool you are able to mine obsidian. Large obsidian plates give a reinforced modifier which increases the durability of your tool. 
Reinforced level X makes a tool unbreakable.

questDatabase.name: Lapis? Lucky!
questDatabase.description: Maybe you were lucky and received the luck modifier on your pickaxe. If not, you may still have an unused modifier on your pick so you can add some lapis lazuli. Or you can perhaps add another modifier by adding a diamond and a gold block to your pick and then add some lapis. You can put the lapis lazuli in more than one slot in the tool station, or use blocks to raise the luck level faster.

questDatabase.name: Redstone? Haste!
questDatabase.description: Mining and digging can be soooo slow. Get some redstone on your pick, shovel or axe to make it faster.

questDatabase.name: Extra Modifier
questDatabase.description:
If you don't have an extra modifier on your tool you can easily add one.
A gold block and a diamond are all you need.
You can add two more modifiers, but you need to figure out how yourself.

questDatabase.name: Ardite and Cobalt
questDatabase.description: If you are done with all quests you can look for cobalt and ardite in the Nether. Remember, you need an electric blast furnace to process these materials before you can make tools with them.

questDatabase.name: Netherquartz? Sharpness
questDatabase.description: Your sword is too dull? Get some nether quartz to sharpen it again.

questDatabase.name: Submission Station
questDatabase.description:
Although many of the questing tasks can be submitted directly through your inventory (including liquids) sometimes you need a more automated solution. This is where the Object Submission Station (OSS) comes in handy. 
Tasks supporting the OSS can be selected through the built in interface to enable its use. Once setup, liquids and items can be either piped in or dropped into the interface's input slot. It will not void items or liquids if no task is selected or if it has already been completed, however, making it relatively safe from accidental item/fluid deletion. Multiple OSS are also capable of taking on separate sub-tasks under the same quest simultaneously!

questDatabase.name: LV Advanced Steam Boiler
questDatabase.description: The LV Gt++ Steam Boiler is the next machine you can build to produce steam more efficiently than with the High Pressure Boiler.

questDatabase.name: ULV Transformer
questDatabase.description: To get your simple ore washer working you need a ULV Transformer. The Washer can only work with 8 EU. If you put more energy into it you get a big hole in your base.

questDatabase.name: Lossless LV Cables
questDatabase.description:
How about losless 32 EU LV Cables ? Redstone alloy is a superconductor wire and will transfer your energy without any loss.
Redalloy is a new alloy which requires an EBF. Mix redstone, silicon and coal by hand, or in the mixer for a better result.

questDatabase.name: Kinetic Power
questDatabase.description:
The Kinetic Generator will transform mechanical energy into electricity. The EU output depends on the KU input. It is most commonly used together with a Kinetic Wind Generator, Kinetic Water Generator  or a Kinetic Steam Generator.

NOTE: It now requires an Avaritia Dire Crafting Table and Titanium. Follow the quests in Space Race and get to the moon.

questDatabase.name: Kinetic Wind Power
questDatabase.description:
The Kinetic Wind Generator generates energy from wind power which varies randomly, although certain factors can change this. 
Unlike the Windmill, the Kinetic Wind Generator will require maintenance in the form of the Rotors. These are needed to run the Kinetic Wind Generator.
Once a Rotor is placed inside the GUI, the block is given sufficient space, and the current wind level is adequate for the current rotor, the Kinetic Wind Generator will begin to generate Kinetic Energy. 
This can be converted into EU by using a Kinetic Generator attached to the correct face (the black circle).
About Wind
First off, the wind strength of a particular area is affected by 3 factors: Height, Weather, and Chance. The higher up in the world you are, the higher the wind level. Below y64, there is never enough wind to be used, and KWG's will not function at all. Weather will also give boosts; Rainy weather will give a 20% boost to normal wind levels, and stormy weather will give a 50% boost. The final factor of chance makes the wind strength vary randomly, however there is a limited range of variation.
The easiest way to check the current wind level in an area is by using a Windmeter.
Wind is strongest at around Y160, towards the build limit of Y255 there is very little wind, hence no point attempting to run Windmills that high.
While inconvenient, the Wind Generator can run anywhere.

You will need to use NEI to see the recipe, since it use the Dire Crafting table. Make sure to put the items in the right place, or you will get a Water Generator instead.

questDatabase.name: Kinetic Water Power
questDatabase.description:
The Kinetic Water Generator allows Kinetic Units to be produced via the movement of water in river and (deep) ocean biomes. As with the Kinetic Wind Generator, it requires either a Wooden, Iron, Steel, Carbon Gearbox Rotor or GT++.

If the Kinetic Water Generator's Rotor isn't entirely submerged in water, it will alert you there is "no room for the rotor". If the Kinetic Water Generator isn't placed in a river, ocean or deep ocean biome, it will alert you it "must be placed in a river or ocean biome".

While inconvenient, the Water Generator runs more consistently.

You will need to use NEI to see the recipe, since it use the Dire Crafting table. Make sure to put the items in the right place, or you will get a Wind Generator instead.

You can use Witchery to convert biomes.

questDatabase.name: Rotor
questDatabase.description: The Kinetic Wind and Water Generators need Rotors to function.  They can be added and removed with standard automation. Higher tier rotors will last longer.

questDatabase.name: Wind Meter
questDatabase.description: The Windmeter measures wind strength. It show's you on which height you can place your Wind Generator.

questDatabase.name: HV Battery Buffers
questDatabase.description:
HV machines need battery buffers too. They come in different sizes like 1x, 4x, 9x and 16x.
Build a 1x and a 4x buffer for HV.

questDatabase.name: HV Batteries
questDatabase.description: Better machines need some better batteries. Let's make some HV battery hulls for new batteries. Now it's up to you to make lithium, cadmium, sodium or acid batteries with these hulls.

questDatabase.name: HV Lithium Batterie
questDatabase.description: Better machines need some better batteries. Lithium is the best material to use when making batteries.

questDatabase.name: HV EV Tranformator
questDatabase.description:
Gregtech cables will not connect to IC2 machines so you need transformers to convert the energy. The best way is building two transformers and a battery buffer to store the generated energy in batteries or energy cells. The longer the cable the more energy will be lost at low tiers. So use high tier voltages when transporting energy over long distances.

Be careful; IC2 machines do not care about rain but your GT machines will explode violently if exposed to water.

It is also important to transfer the power up, not down, to avoid explosions if the rotor generates more than 120 EU/t. It is not recommenend to use better rotors than the iron ones on HV tier.

questDatabase.name: GT 6 styled Pipes
questDatabase.description:
Maybe you are wondering why the new pipes don't auto-connect anymore? This was changed to make the pipe smarter. You can now use a wrench to connect only the pipes you want. You don't need a plate or a foil to prevent pipes from connecting anymore (You'll still want to cover hot pipes to prevent getting hurt!). Shift clicking on the end of a pipe will disable the fluid input on that side. This is super handy, for example, to prevent coal boilers from feeding back steam into water pipes. 

Also, pipes now come with a shutter built in for free to reduce sloshing. Shift-rightclick with a wrench on the side you want prevent input.

Hint: If you click one pipe onto the other they will auto-connect.

questDatabase.name: GT 6 styled Wires and Cables
questDatabase.description:
Maybe you are wondering why the new wires and cables don't auto-connect anymore? This was changed to make the wires and cables smarter. You have to use a wirecutter or soldering iron to connect the wires and cables on the side you want. No more burnt cables or wrongly connected wires and cables from now on. You can shift-rightclick to attach a cable on the side of a machine you cannot see, like attaching a cable to the bottom while looking at the front.

Hint: If you click one wire or cable on the other it will auto-connect. Cables and pipes can be painted to make sure you do not cross your MV line with your EV line, or dump hot lava into your plastic water pipes. No boom today.

questDatabase.name: MV Machine hull
questDatabase.description: The next tier of machine hull needs aluminium - a lot of aluminium. Keep your EBF running and make some aluminium.

questDatabase.name: A new alloy - Magnalium
questDatabase.description:
You wonder why you need magnalium now? It's not for GT machines right now but for a material update for your crossbow.
It's a very good material in LV Tier. Go to the Twilight Forest and find an Olivine/Glauconite vein located at Y 10-40 or in the Overworld a Glauconite Soapstone mix located at Y 20-50 and a Granitic Mineral Vein in the Overworld Located at Y 50-60 (The Gypsum vein you will need for the Bricked Blast Furnace).
With your Ore Washer you can get Magnesium and Aluminium out of the Ores (Magnesite for Magnesium (marbel can be used too)and Fullers Earth for Aluminium) and mix it in the Alloy smelter to Magnalium.
Magnesite gives 10 tiny piles of Magnesium each dust but fullers earth gives only a tiny pile of Aluminium.

questDatabase.name: Magnalium Crossbow
questDatabase.description: Now its time to craft your Crossbow Limb and the Crossbow Body to upgrade your old Wooden Crossbow.

questDatabase.name: Wooden Crosbow
questDatabase.description:
Now you are able to make a better long range weapon - a crossbow. Use wood for the the crossbow limb and the body and use obsidian (Reinforced III) for the tough binding. Normal strings for the bowstrings would be enough for now.

Assemble the bow yourself on your tool forge.

questDatabase.name: Fiery Bowstring
questDatabase.description: Why not upgrade your bowstring too?. If you cannnot find any fiery strings in the Nether you got some from the last quest. Craft some fiery bowstring with it.

questDatabase.name: Ardite Crossbow Body
questDatabase.description:
To make your crossbow even better craft an ardite crossbow body. You received a few ardite ingots as reward before.
With redstone you can make your bow faster. This requires a free modifier slot on your crossbow.

questDatabase.name: Magnalium Crossbow Bolts
questDatabase.description:
Magnalium bolts are much better than your old wooden bolts.
You can use nether quartz on the bolts to make them even better. 
This requires a free modifier slot.
NOTE: Unlike other tinker tools and weapons, bolts cannot be upgraded.  You will need to make a fresh one. Experiment with NEI to find other good bolt materials. 

To make it, you must use a Fluid Solidifer instead of the Tinker's casting table.

questDatabase.name: Basic Fluid Solidifier
questDatabase.description: To get your molten fluids back to a solid state you need a fluid solidifier. It is used for crossbow bolts as well.

questDatabase.name: Iron Tipped Bolts
questDatabase.description: Your crossbow need some ammo to shoot with. Let's craft some wooden bolts with an iron tip. You'll need to pump smeltery iron into a fluid solidifier.

questDatabase.name: Rubber Soft Mallet
questDatabase.description: Your wooden soft mallet breaks after a few uses. Now you can make a rubber mallet which is much more durable.

questDatabase.name: Iron Wood
questDatabase.description:
Ironwood is much harder and durable than rubber. Ideal for a soft mallet. Collect some liveroot, macerate it and mix the powder with iron and gold to create a new magical material.

You can make some unique armor with this material.

questDatabase.name: Steeleaf
questDatabase.description:
If you locate a labyrinth you may find steeleaf in chests inside if you are lucky.
This is the best material for a soft mallet, however a unique armor out of steeleaf would be an even better use for this material.

questDatabase.name: Empty Cells
questDatabase.description: With your plate bender you are able to make empty cells. The circuit needs to be configured to 12 otherwise you will make foil. Once you have an MV Extruder, you can make cells directly from ingots.

questDatabase.name: Redalloy Cable
questDatabase.description: Want some redalloy cable? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Tin Cable
questDatabase.description: Want some tin cable? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Copper Wire
questDatabase.description: Want some copper wires? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Universal Macerator
questDatabase.description: One of the important machines in HV is the Universal Macerator. It has an additional output slot to get more materials when macerating ores.

questDatabase.name: Rubber Ingots
questDatabase.description: Want some rubber ingots? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Quartz and Quartzite Veins
questDatabase.description: The Nether is full of different kinds of quartz. Go and find a quartzite and certus quartz vein. They are located between Y levels 40-80.

questDatabase.name: Lithium
questDatabase.description: Lithium can be washed out of Lepidolite Ore or centrifuged out of Spodumene Ore. At MV you can electrolyze clay dust for it. Look for canyons to find hardened clay and macerate it for dust.

questDatabase.name: Sodium
questDatabase.description: Sodium can be washed out of Glauconite Ore and Sand. It can also be electrolyzed out of salt.

questDatabase.name: Bath Salt
questDatabase.description: Oh you feel so dirty. Go and take a bath.

questDatabase.name: Bath Soap
questDatabase.description: Oh you feel so dirty. Get the soap and take a long hot bath to get rid of some of that nasty Warp.

questDatabase.name: Damascus Steel Ingots
questDatabase.description: Damascus Steel is very durable und useful for GT tools. Buy some.

questDatabase.name: Cheaper Annealed Production
questDatabase.description: It' s even faster and cheaper to make annealed copper in the arc furnace than in the electric blast furnace. Annealed copper is a very good material for cables in MV. It only loses 1 EU per block.

questDatabase.name: Wrought Iron Ingots
questDatabase.description: Whant some wrought iron ingots?  Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Steel Ingots
questDatabase.description: Want some steel ingots?  Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Aluminium Ingots
questDatabase.description: Want some aluminium ingots? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Stainless Steel Ingots
questDatabase.description: Want some stainless steel ingots? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Thaumium cooking
questDatabase.description: Now it is time to cook your first thaumium ingots. After researching it you need iron ingots and praecantatio aspect to make it.

questDatabase.name: Food 2.0
questDatabase.description:
Forget everything you know about food and values. With your new canning machine you are able to fill tin cans with very nourishing food. This food can be consumed in milliseconds and makes you full and happy. And you can eat as much as you want without getting tired of the food.
Eating before you are starving restores saturation and conserves cans.

questDatabase.name: EBF Infos
questDatabase.description:
You can use a scanner to manually check how your EBF works, or you can make an information panel from nuclear control and always see the status. Make a GT sensor kit and use it on the EBF controller. Place the the sensor card in your info panel. Enable it with a redstone signal.

The GregTech sensor card can monitor Gregtech machines like the EBF, Turbines, and Pyrolyse ovens. This is handy for keeping an eye on maintenance issues for multiblocks.

If you want to put the panels far from the machines they are monitoring, you will need range upgrades.

questDatabase.name: Passive Chunkloading
questDatabase.description:
Using the MV bender you can finally press dense plates. Let's craft some passive chunkloaders.
3x3 chunks are loaded. You need coins to power the chunkloader. 
Personal anchors can be powered with ender pearls for 4 hours per pearl, passive anchors 1 hour per pearl. 

World anchors are always loaded. Personal anchors are loaded while the player is logged in. Passive only loads once the owner visits, and stays loaded until they logout.

questDatabase.name: Minecart with Tank, Workbench or Furnace
questDatabase.description: You want to transport oil or other fluids, have a portable crafting table or a portable chest? Then you need to craft some minecarts with tanks, chests or crafting tables.

questDatabase.name: Fluid loader and unloder
questDatabase.description: If you plan to automate the oil transport from your oil field far away, you need a fluid loader and unloader. A locking track will stop the train as long as oil is loaded or unloaded.

questDatabase.name: Locomotive 0.1 Alpha
questDatabase.description: The furnace cart is a cheaper locomotive. Click with coal or charcoal on the cart and and it will start moving.

questDatabase.name: Steam Locomotive
questDatabase.description: The steam locomotive is much better than the furnace cart. You can control the speed and the direction the locomotive will move. You need to put water and coal inside to make steam to power the locomotive.

questDatabase.name: Electric Locomotive
questDatabase.description: Electric Locomotives are much better than steam ones. You need electric rail for it.

questDatabase.name: Boost your speed
questDatabase.description: If you decide to not use a locomotive and drive with one or two carts only, you can use some booster tracks. Activate them with a lever or a redstone torch.

questDatabase.name: The transcontinental railroad - high speed
questDatabase.description: Did you ever dream of driving in a railcart at high speeds? Well your dreams can come true with the high speed tracks. Be careful though; you need to lower the speed when your rails change direction or when the track ends.

questDatabase.name: The transcontinental railroad - blast proof
questDatabase.description:
Railroads in the nether are dangerous. The reinforced tracks are blast proof. Hope you are blast proof too. 
You can move 25% faster than with normal tracks.

Nei not shows the right recipe on the first page. Switch a bit through the recipes to find the right one.

questDatabase.name: The transcontinental railroad electrical
questDatabase.description:
Electrical tracks are used together with your electrical locomotive. You need to power the rails with energy.

Nei not shows the right recipe on the first page. Switch a bit through the recipes to find the right one.

questDatabase.name: Electric feeder Unit
questDatabase.description: To get your tracks electrified you need an electric feeding unit, shunting wires and some support frames. You can use an MFE or a transformer to get GT energy into the feeder unit.

questDatabase.name: Magic "Staffter"
questDatabase.description: It is also possible to create a bizarre hybrid of staff and scepter (sometimes called a "staffter"), by using a staff core instead of a wand core in the scepter recipe. The resulting device can neither hold a focus nor be placed in a crafting table, but it can still be used to activate constructs, or as a "vis battery" for Repair-enchanted equipment or Runic shielding.

questDatabase.name: Aluminum berries
questDatabase.description: And a few aluminum berries for cash.

questDatabase.name: Gold berries
questDatabase.description: And a few gold berries for cash.

questDatabase.name: Iron berries
questDatabase.description: And a few iron berries for cash.

questDatabase.name: Copper berries
questDatabase.description: And a few copper berries for cash.

questDatabase.name: Tin berries
questDatabase.description: And a few tin berries for cash.

questDatabase.name: Fusion reactor MK2 - bigger, better, fusor
questDatabase.description: Now that you have some europium, put it to use by making an mk2 reactor. This one will require the same block placement, but replacing LuV casings with fusion machine casings, superconducting coil blocks with fusion coil blocks, and using ZPM tier hatches. This reactor can handle recipes up to 320M eu startup. In addition, if you perform an mk1 recipe on an mk2, you will overclock it. Fusion overclocking is different than normal gt. It will take 2x the power, but the recipe will go 2x faster.

questDatabase.name: Upgrading the reactor
questDatabase.description: A mark 2 is nice, but why not make a mark 3? It will double the power needed per recipe, while cutting the processing time in half. This time you will need UV or above hatches, as well as Fusion machine casings MK2. This reactor is capable of doing all fusion recipes. Each energy hatch is capable of providng up to 8192eu/t, per energy hatch, for the recipe. The reactor can take as little as 8192eu/t to run. The UV hatch can accept up to 2 amps of 524288eu/t before it explodes, as usual.

questDatabase.name: Making americium
questDatabase.description: Before you can upgrade your reactor, you will need to get some americium. The recipe will look pretty expensive, but once you made the next tier of reactor, you will unlock a simplier and cheaper one. You will need at least 128 plates for the reactor casings, 9 to scan for the recipe, and 4 to build one.

questDatabase.name: Making power with your plasma
questDatabase.description: Now that you have a reactor, it's time to utilize it. The simplest plasma you can make for power is Helium plasma. It's renewable from water, but also provides a lot of power. However, you will need a way to convert the plasma into EU. To do this you will need a large plasma turbine. This will also need a dynamo hatch that can handle the power you're outputting. For Helium plasma, you will want a UV or above hatch.

questDatabase.name: Turbine Time
questDatabase.description: Your fancy new Large Plasma Turbine will need a rotor to go inside of it. You can make it out of any gt material, but the best are trinium, awakened draconium and neutronium. Trinium will give you the most eu/t out of a single multiblock, with the best efficiency. Neutronium will give you the longest lasting turbine rotors with a lower efficiency, and less power per reactor. Awakened draconium will give you a balance between the two. You can make turbines in 4 different sizes. The larger the turbine the more eu/t it will produce. However, the largest turbine isn't also the most efficient. When using turbines be careful of flow rates. To find the optimal flow rate, you divide the optimal energy flow rate listen on the turbine, by the energy value for the plasma. Make sure to use a fluid regulator set to this flow rate.

questDatabase.name: Time for another reactor
questDatabase.description: While one reactor is nice and all, why not make another? This time you can use the MK3 americium recipe to make it easier.

questDatabase.name: Making more americium
questDatabase.description: Costing just 1 ingot of Plutonium, and 2 buckets of hydrogen, this recipe is much easier and faster than the MK2 version. By making americium plasma, then putting it through a turbine, you will get americium in the liquid state. Again you will need at least 132 plates for the controller, and the fusion machine casings.

questDatabase.name: Crafting time
questDatabase.description: It's time to get yourself a 3x3 crafting area. Grab some flint and some wood, and build one!

questDatabase.name: Hoppers
questDatabase.description:
Hoppers come in handy when you want to automate your machines. 
You can input items via hoppers directly into GT pipes and you don't have to use a conveyor belt. 
However, the input rate is much slower, and the hopper must be beneath its source inventory.

questDatabase.name: Light Fuel
questDatabase.description: Want some light fuel? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Heavy Fuel
questDatabase.description: Want some heavy fuel? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Power Solar
questDatabase.description: Your cart needs power, obviously. A cart can be powered via coal, solar or lava. If you are able to make solar panels you can power your cart with the sun.

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Digging
questDatabase.description: Want to automate digging for ores ? A drill head made out of iron is the cheapest alternative.

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Thermal Engine
questDatabase.description: Your cart needs power, obviously. A cart can be powered via coal, solar or lava. Why not power your cart with lava?

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: More Storage
questDatabase.description: After you craft side chests you can add more different chests to the cart. Some sides are reserved for tools so no chest can be placed there.

questDatabase.name: Starting Fusion
questDatabase.description: Now that your power needs are increasing, you need a way to keep up with demand. To generate over 1A ZPM with a single machine you have two options: solars, and fusion. While solars are simpler to set up, solars cap out at 524288eu/t. Fusion can reach levels close to eight times that with the right setup. For your first reactor, you will need a controller, 2-16 fluid input hatches, 1-16 fluid output hatches, and 16 energy hatches. All hatches have to be LuV tier or better. Each hatch provides 2048eu/t for the recipe, and has a storage capacity of 160M eu. This means you can do any fusion recipe that takes less than 32768eu/t or less, and has a startup of 160M eu or less. Using more fluid hatches means you need less fusion casings. While this doesn't matter as much for the mk1 reactor, this principle helps tremendously with the high reactor tiers.

questDatabase.name: Getting europium
questDatabase.description: To make an mk2 reactor, you will need europium. Once you make a t6 rocket you will be able to find this as an ore. Until then you need to produce it in the reactor.

questDatabase.name: Clockwork Engine
questDatabase.description: Producing RF Power by hand is a good idea for making one or two recipes in the Forestry machines. The turrets can be charged with it too.

questDatabase.name: Bio Gas Engine
questDatabase.description:
Producing RF Power with Lava is possible with the Biogas engine. You need Water, Seedoil, Milk, Sap Cresote or FR Biomass in the other slot. The engine outputs 50RF/t depends on the fluid you put in.

Fuel /Lava /  Usage Energy Ticks
Water Constant 10 RF/t 1000
Fruit Juice Startup/Restart Only 10 RF/t 2500
Liquid Honey Startup/Restart Only 20 RF/t 2500
Milk Constant 10 RF/t 10000
Seed Oil Startup/Restart Only 30 RF/t 2500
Biomass Startup/Restart Only 50 RF/t 2500

questDatabase.name: Peat fired Engine
questDatabase.description:
Peat fired engines use Peat or Bituminous Peat to run. Peat burns for 5000 ticks and produces 10 RF every tick, 1 peat makes 0.66 Ash, so you get 2 Ash for burning 3 peat.
Bituminous Peat burns for 6000 ticks and produces 20 RF/tick.

Peat Farms can be setup by using a managed farm with tin electron tubes. It is possible with a manual farm too.

questDatabase.name: Copper, Tin, Bronze Tubes
questDatabase.description:
Electron tubes are used to set farms to a special kind of crop and can be used in engines, alvearies and some crafting recipes.

Use a soldering iron to attach an electron tube to a circuit board.

questDatabase.name: Iron, Gold, Diamantine Tubes
questDatabase.description:
Electron tubes are used to set farms to a special kind of crop and can be used in engines, alvearies and some crafting recipes.

Use a soldering iron to attach an electron tube to a circuit board.

questDatabase.name: Rubberised, Obsidian, Lapis Tubes
questDatabase.description:
Electron tubes are used to set farms to a special kind of crop and can be used in engines, alvearies and some crafting recipes.

Use a soldering iron to attach an electron tube to a circuit board.

questDatabase.name: Blaze, Endereyes, Emerald Tubes
questDatabase.description:
Electron tubes are used to set farms to a special kind of crop and can be used in engines, alvearies and some crafting recipes.

Use a soldering iron to attach an electron tube to a circuit board.

questDatabase.name: Advanced Circuit Assembler
questDatabase.description: More advanced circuits require an MV circuit assembling machine. Let's make one.

questDatabase.name: Advanced Circuit Assembler II
questDatabase.description: With your workstation circuits you can craft an HV circuit assembler. This is need for higher tier circuits.

questDatabase.name: EV Circuits Assembler
questDatabase.description: An EV circuit assembler requires IV Circuits to craft. With this assembler you can make a lot more high tier circuits.

questDatabase.name: Epoxid
questDatabase.description: Epoxid is needed for your advanced Circuits boards. You need Sodium Hydroxide, Epichlorohydrin and Bispenol A to make it.

questDatabase.name: IV Circuit Mainframe
questDatabase.description: Mainframes are the first IV Circuits you can make in HV. Used for EV and IV machines and components.

questDatabase.name: Glycerol
questDatabase.description: Glycerol becomes important in creating epoxid in the next tiers. It is important for TNT production too. It is left over when producing bio diesel.

questDatabase.name: HCL
questDatabase.description: HCl becomes important for your epoxid production in HV/EV tier.

questDatabase.name: Epichlorohydrin
questDatabase.description: Epichlorohydrin is another product needed in your epoxid production. Mix glycerol and HCl together.

questDatabase.name: Phenol
