questDatabase.description:
Time for a second blast furnace! 

You can make ingots faster 3 ways - better coils, higher tier energy hatches, or adding more furnaces. It's probably time to add a second EBF to your base. EBFs can share walls and input/output hatches, but not mufflers or energy hatches.

Remember pollution will be very high with two EBFs active at once!
Watch out for high pollution effects. Use the best mufflers available and don't place the EBFs in the same chunk as farmland or other high pollution machines like pyrolyze ovens and large boilers.

You can use whatever coils you have lying around, but you might want to start searching for Mica if you haven't found any yet.

questDatabase.name: All alone in the night
questDatabase.description:
If you are playing single player survival, updates mean having to reload default quests. Use this block to do it for you without having to enter creative mode - you don't lose progress, but you'll have new quests to complete!

Sorry, no rewards, other than the satisfaction of knowing it's you versus the world.

questDatabase.name: How the heck do I find ores?
questDatabase.description:
GregTech ore generation is based on veins. Veins are centered on orecenters, based on the chunk number. To find the chunk number, hit F3. In the X and Z lines you will see numbers like
c: 3 (14)
c: -2 (1)

The 3,-2 is the chunk's address. Ignore the negative sign.  Now, the orecenters are located at 3N+1 chunks.  So, 4,7 is an orecenter. 10,16. -22,19.  Etc. 

Protip: to find out if a number is divisible by 3, add the digits and see if the sum is divisible by 3.  So 86 = 8+6 = 14. So you need to go down 1 chunk or up 2 chunks so that you are on a 3N+1 chunk.

For reading all the way, I'll give you an ingot of iron.

questDatabase.name: Digging deeper
questDatabase.description:
Now that you know where to dig, dig all the way down to bedrock to find if there is a vein located there.

Now, what if you know what you want but notwhere to find it? Our fancy bartimausnek developer has added a nifty feature to NEI that shows you where to find ores! Simply look for the oreblock in NEI, and click on it for info on where to find that ore.

Make sure you look for the Gregtech variety of the ore.

questDatabase.name: A dimension by any other name...
questDatabase.description:
Use this table to decode dimension names

OW - Overworld
Ne - Nether
TF - Twilight Forest
EN - End
VA - Vanilla End Asteroids
EA - End Asteroids
Mo - Moon
Ma - Mars
As - Mars Asteroids
BC - Barnard C
BE - Barnard E
BF - Barnard F
Ca - Callisto
CA - Centauri A
Ce - Ceres
De - Deimos
En - Enceladus
Eu - Europa
Ga - Ganymeade
Ha - Haumea
Io - Io
KB - Kuiper Belt
MM - Makemake
Me - Mercury
Mi - Miranda
Ob - Oberon
Ph - Phobos
Pl - Pluto
Pr - Proteus
TE - Tau Ceti E
Ti - Titan
Tr - Triton
VB - Vega B
Ve - Venus
DD - Deep Dark/Underdark

questDatabase.name: Chemical bath
questDatabase.description:
Wait, what? You want more byproducts from your ores?  A cheaper way to make paper? Well, the chemical bath is perfect for you! 

You'll have to provide liquids like mercury to extract different products like nickel, silver, copper, and platinum from ores. 

For paper you'll only need some water and wood pulp. Maybe you'll find more uses for it!

questDatabase.name: Better Questing?
questDatabase.description: For quests to save properly, you must be online and logged into your Mojang account.  Sorry, it's a limitation of Better Questing.

questDatabase.name: Backup your stuff...
questDatabase.description:
Single player? Please install your preferred backup mod, or use the command line to backup your game. Not sure which to use? AromaBackup for 1.7.10 works pretty well.

Remember though Journeymap and Thaumcraft Node Tracker information isn't included with AromaBackup, so you should backup your journeymap and tcnodetracker directories after exploration.

questDatabase.name: Tesla would be proud
questDatabase.description: Tired of sticking your EnderIO items in the capacitor bank to charge it? Time to make a wireless charger.

questDatabase.name: Nobody wants an explosion...
questDatabase.description:
...right?  So when building multiblocks, make sure you

1. Don't cross chunk boundaries with the multiblock.

2. Don't rely on resources coming from outside the chunk to prevent explosions.  In other words, make sure you source your water locally.

Good luck.

questDatabase.name: Divine rod of the gods?
questDatabase.description:
The ore finder rod takes some of the tedium out of finding an ore.  You'll need to find some first to make it, but once you have it you can use ore blocks to find more ore. It only tells you if that specific ore is nearby. Later you will want to return with better digging tools and check every spot.

Be sure to use your NEI skills to figure out which oreblock is the best choice for your needs.

Other basic ore blocks can be purchased from the Coins tab.

To use, shift click when looking at stone to open inventory and put the block into the slot.

As you get close, you will see and hear a response from the ore finder tool.

questDatabase.name: Not enough items
questDatabase.description:
More like too many items!

Here are some tips for using NEI.

When you have your inventory open, you can type the search terms in the text bar.  Make sure your GUI size is set correctly, or you won't be able to see it. Double-click the bar to highlight any matching items in your inventory. Handy for searching that obsidian chest!

Even better, you can use T to search nearby inventories, which will emit some particles.

O will make the NEI information hide.

questDatabase.name: NEI is more powerful than you imagine
questDatabase.description:
NEI has some really nice advanced features too.

Click on an item to see the recipe to create it, and press Backspace to go back to the previous recipe. 

Hold Shift to stop the oredict toggling items, and to show the oredict entries for the current item under your cursor.

Search using #oredict to find items that match that oredict; for example, #dyewhite will list all white dyes.

Search using @mod. to find all items from that mod; for example, @mod.gt++ will list all GT++ blocks.

Use * (asterisk) as a wild card.  For example large * fluid pipe will show you all the large fluid pipes.

It has more advanced features, you should check the web for details.

questDatabase.name: Making a list, checking it twice
questDatabase.description: As your base grows, you're going to have a dozen different long term goals each with many steps. Build a clipboard to keep track of what you need to do.

questDatabase.name: A better crafting table
questDatabase.description:
Tired of your stuff falling out of your crafting table every time you walk away?  This fancy table from Tinker's Construct has slots to hold the items in your recipe. 

You can also place it next to a tool station or tool forge to upgrade with 8 modifiers at a time. Very handy for additional speed or looting!

When it is placed next to a vanilla chest, it will even show the chest's inventory in the crafting window. Single or double vanilla chests only please.

Cut it again for a sleek, low profile version.

questDatabase.name: Travelocity!
questDatabase.description: A staff of traveling can get you really moving around your base.

questDatabase.name: Biomes everywhere, but not the one you want?
questDatabase.description:
Tired of searching all over the map for that Bamboo Forest or Tropical rainforest?  Desperate for clay dust and need to find a Canyon biome?

Nature's compass will lead you to the biome you are looking for, if it is within range.

questDatabase.name: Humid and warm?
questDatabase.description: Stop guessing what the humidity and temperature are for your biome. Use the habitat locator to get a reading on your current climate.

questDatabase.name: Put the drones in a jar and shake it up
questDatabase.description:
Once you get good effects from your bees, instead of just trashing the excessive drones, you can put them in collector's jars to get the effects anywhere in your base.

Healing? XP? Poison?

The collector's jars can even be piped or connected to a conveyor so that drones last a long time.

questDatabase.name: Magic frames
questDatabase.description: Alternatively, you can try going through the Apimancy tree of your Thauminomicon to make Magic Frames. They're the core of magically endowed frames.

questDatabase.name: Chocolate frame
questDatabase.description: The chocolate frame can be used to increase production, but reduces lifetime. A shrewd beekeeper can use this to speed up mutation by using 3 in an apiary to kill off queens quickly.

questDatabase.name: Are the bees buzzing, or screaming?
questDatabase.description: Soul frames don't shorten the life of the bee as much as chocolate frames, but they greatly increase the chances of a mutation.

questDatabase.name: Bees buzzing beyond the dark
questDatabase.description: If even the soul frame takes too long for your taste, the oblivion frame will destroy a bee in a single bee tick (27s). Be careful using more than one, there are rumors it might harm your princesses...

questDatabase.name: Need a place for all those ores?
questDatabase.description: How about a compressed chest from Avaritia?

questDatabase.name: All the crops you could want
questDatabase.description: Tired of applying bonemeal or fertilizer by hand? A sprinkler can take water and boost your crop growth rate.  Bonemeal or fertilizer will make it work even faster.

questDatabase.name: Portable tanks too small?
questDatabase.description: How about large steel fluid cells instead?  Each holds 8, and they can stack to 64. Unfortunately, you have to load and unload them using GT machines, but hey, 512 buckets in a single slot is pretty good!

questDatabase.name: Large Aluminium Fluid Cells
questDatabase.description: 512 buckets in a stack not cutting it?  Aluminium cells can hold 32 buckets per cell, and stack to 64. 2,048 buckets in a single stack? That's half a supertank!

questDatabase.name: Separating gems from the dust
questDatabase.description: The sifter runs so slow, you should make an HV sifter to get gems faster.

questDatabase.name: Portable prospecting tool
questDatabase.description:
Now that you have some tech, you've discovered a way to prospect for ores. This tool only has a chance at finding the ores in a chunk. If you are clever, you can use it to locate ores.

Unfortunately, the tech to make it repairable or rechargeable doesn't work yet, so you'll have to make a new one each time it breaks.

And since it doesn't make a convenient book like the seismic prospector, you'll have to keep track on your own where the ores are found.

Good luck.

questDatabase.name: Can't find those ores?
questDatabase.description:
Having trouble locating some of the basic ores? Trade in some coins for oreblocks to use in the Ore Finder Wand.

If you are clever, you can use one oreblock to find a vein containing another oreblock to use to find another vein.  For example, if you choose Redstone, you can use that to find Cinnabar, which can be used to find Thaumcraft Aspect Shard ores in the Twilight Forest.  Experiment and find some combos!

questDatabase.name: Better bolts
questDatabase.description:
Now that you are in MV and have an EBF, you can make new bolts with vanadiumsteel-tipped magnalium.  Your enemies will tremble at your might.

Check "fletching" under NEI for fletching options.

Good hunting!

questDatabase.name: Best bolts?
questDatabase.description:
That meteoric iron you found on the moon, when sent through the EBF, turns into this amazing meteoric steel, able to keep a fine edge. Put some on an Energetic Alloy tool rod to make an awesome bolt. Your next bolt you'll have to figure out yourself.

Fletching left as an exercise for the reader.

questDatabase.name: Best crossbow?
questDatabase.description:
Energetic alloy has proven to be an amazing material.  It's light weight and high stiffness makes it perfect for a crossbow limb. It is slightly slower to draw but has amazing stopping power with its very high bolt speed. 

The material would also make an excellent bolt body. Perhaps you will find a suitable tip to match?

questDatabase.name: Caging a demon - Wither killing chamber
questDatabase.description:
Ever wanted to trap a wither but the only option was non moveable bedrock? Now that you made dark steel you can get reinforced obsidian which is wither-proof. Useful for hand killing and even automation once you get a powered spawner supplying you with wither skeleton skulls.

Hint: Unlike vanilla obsidian reinforced obsidian CAN be moved by pistons which might come in handy.

questDatabase.name: Personal Chunkloading
questDatabase.description:
Let's craft some personal chunkloaders. You need double gold plates, obsidian plates, diamond plates and a ender pearl.
3x3 chunks are loaded. You need coins to power the chunkloader. 
Personal and passive anchors can also be powered with ender pearls for 4 hour per pearl, 1h in passive anchors . Personal anchors can powered also with ender fragments for 1h.  

World anchors are always loaded. Personal anchors are loaded while the player is logged in. Passive only loads once the owner visits, and stays loaded until they logout.

questDatabase.name: Chunkloading
questDatabase.description:
With your hv assembler you can craft a world anchor.
3x3 chunks are loaded. You need coins to power the chunkloader. 
Personal anchors can be powered with ender pearls for 4 hours per pearl, passive anchors 1 hour per pearl. 

World anchors are always loaded. Personal anchors are loaded while the player is logged in. Passive only loads once the owner visits, and stays loaded until they logout.

questDatabase.name: Ceres Dungeon
questDatabase.description:
After hours and you will find a Ceres dungeon. A big hole will show you the way to the dungeon. Go and fight some mobs before you have to kill the Boss Monster. It will drop the key for the chest with the schematics for tier 4 rockets.
This will open the Planets Venus, Mercury and the Jupiter Moon IO.

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 Schematic
questDatabase.description: Each rocket needs a construction plan. Scan it in a hv scanner and put the construction data on a data stick. The third tier schematic circuit uses an elite circuit and a heavy duty plate tier 4 and the data stick in a iv circuit assembler.

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 Heavy Duty Plates
questDatabase.description: Rockets require heavy duty plates for the main hull. Let's craft 12 tier 4 heavy duty plates out of tier 3 plates and compressed ice plates.

questDatabase.name: Callisto Trip
questDatabase.description: Callisto Ice is the material you need  for Tier 4 Rockets. Look at Y 40-60.

questDatabase.name: Europa Trip
questDatabase.description: Ledox is the material you need  for Tier 4 Rockets which can be find on Europa. Look at Y 55-65.

questDatabase.name: Rocket Tier 4
questDatabase.description: After weeks of hard work and a thaousand tons of stacks of iTNT your fourth rocket is finally ready. But before you can go to the Io, Venus or Mecury you need to craft a few more things.

questDatabase.name: I ain't afraid of no ghost!
questDatabase.description:
I've found a use for the Ectoplasm you can collect from spirits of the dead.
It makes a very useful glass that you can walk on, but mobs cannot.  However, they think they can!  So you can use this to create a moat around your base that drops mobs to the death in various ways, or just to shuttle them off somewhere else. Separate babies from mothers? Use it in a mob farm?  So many possibilities!

questDatabase.name: Black and Decker
questDatabase.description:
Tired of having to replace tools all the time? Now that stainless steel is available, it's time to make some electric versions of the screwdriver and wrench! Charge them up like a battery, and they will last much longer than normal versions of the tools.

You can use lithium batteries, or if you are on a budget cadmium batteries instead. 

Later Vibrant Alloy will make excellent tools with great durability.

questDatabase.name: Titan Ingots
questDatabase.description: Want some titan ingots? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Tungsten Steel Ingots
questDatabase.description: Want some tungesten steel ingots? Buy some!

questDatabase.name: Magnalium Source
questDatabase.description: Magnesite the source of Magnesium can be found in Twilight Forest at Y 10-40. Fullers Earth can be found on the Overworld at Y 50-70. Marbel dust can be used for magnesium dust also.

questDatabase.name: Anylyze your crops
questDatabase.description:
The cropnalyzer is a powered tool used to analyze IC2 crop seedbags. To fully analyze a seed bag, you will need to put it through the cropnalyzer four times. If the crop is already planted, it is better to analyze it with the portable scanner instead of breaking it just to scan it.

You may have noticed that NEI does not include every possible combination. The cropnalyzer also has a feature called the IC2 Crop Calculator, where you can find the chance outputs of breeding together any crops. To access the calculator, hit the IC2 side inventory key while holding the cropnalyzer. You can also do this while sneaking, and it will have a different gui, where you can select any crops from a row instead of needing to use them from your inventory.

In either of the GUIs, you can choose up to four crops to breed together. Then click "process" and the bottom row will show the possible crossbreeding outputs, and their weights. You can use the + and - gui buttons to scroll through the row(s) of crops. You can also use a button in the GUI to sort the rows by tier or weight. You can invert the sorting by hitting the sorting button while holding shift.

When trying to get a specific crop, you generally want to maximize it's weight. But more specifically, you want to maximize the proportion of its weight out of all the weights. This means there are usually no benefits or downsides to breeding 3 or 4 crops together instead of 2, since all weights are increased evenly.

Try a variety of combinations to get the crops you want. Often, breeding together two of the same crop is a surprisingly good option or even the best one.

questDatabase.name: Crop automation
questDatabase.description:
The Crop-Matron is a LV machine that will monitor crops in a 9x9x3 area and automatically apply fertilizer, Weed-EX, and Water as needed. Water can be added to the Crop-Matron with Fluid Cells, or pumped in directly.

Use Weed-EX sparingly, since overuse will affect crops negatively. Tilled dirt still requires a nearby water block to be hydrated as the Matron will only water the crop, not the soil.

questDatabase.name: Weed Ex
questDatabase.description:
Weed-EX is used to prevent the growth of Weeds on empty Crop blocks at the cost of crop quality. Damage to the crop's quality is permanent and cannot be reversed, aside from complete removal.

Usage:
While holding Weed-Ex, right-click on a Crop to apply it. It can also be placed in a Crop-Matron to automatically apply it to your crops. Overuse will reduce crop quality, capping their stats at 10.

questDatabase.name: Fish Oil
questDatabase.description: To make some bio diesel you need seed oil or fish oil and mix that with ethanol or methanol. Seeds give seed oil and fish produce fish oil when placed in a fluid extractor.

questDatabase.name: Time to ore drill!
questDatabase.description:
Auto Miner are nice but you're going to reach a point where you will want MOOOOOOOOOOOOORE ores. This multiblock will help with that but you will need to search for ores using a seismic prospector or the advanced one. 

Higher tiers of power will drill faster. You need to upgrade the energy hatch corresponding to the power tier. 

Later you can upgrade the ore drilling plant so it extracts from more than a 48 block radius.

You need mining pipes in the machine block and drilling fluid in the fluid hatch.

questDatabase.name: Rare ores
questDatabase.description:
Did you look for days to find Diamonds, Redstone, Tatalite, Certus Quartz or Mica? 
Well for a few mixes you can use different ores like Coal for Diamond Vein or Quarzite Ore for Certus Quartz Vein. Mica ore mix can be found if you have Tin Ore.
Bauxite in the nether can be found with copper ore.

questDatabase.name: Press all the things in MV
questDatabase.description: With the mv forming press you can make aluminiun iron plates for solar panels and a few rotors blades for turbines.

questDatabase.name: Inputting chest for Ghetto ME System
questDatabase.description:
To be able to put items into the Ghetto ME system you need just a few additional pipes.
The Extraction pipe should be connected to the chest you want to take items from.
Inside the Extraction pipe you need to put the Item Extraction chip, and configure it to blacklist if you want it to take all items from the chest.

The Routed Junction pipe is needed so the items inside the pipes know which direction to take, without this they will just fly around inside the pipes without knowing where to go.
You might also need some additional item transport pipes depending on your setup.

questDatabase.name: Plunger 2.0 The Hand Pump
questDatabase.description:
The new hand pump can remove fluids out of your machine input slots. The pluinger removes the fluid only the hand pump can store it and drain it to a tank.

Use your coin in a lv assembler to craft a hand pump.

questDatabase.name: More seed types
questDatabase.description: This fancy addon allows your cart to plant/harvest more seed types. If you got an MV+ centrifuge you might want to look at glow flowers for some free redstone and gold.

questDatabase.name: More tree types
questDatabase.description: The standard wood cutter can only chop down (and replant) vanilla trees. If you want to use saplings from other mods however this addon will come in handy. Who knows - maybe you are tired of clicking rubber trees with a treetap.

questDatabase.name: Further automation
questDatabase.description: If you want to load and unload a lot of different items from your cargo manager the pipes can get quite messy. The external distributor is a block you can place next to your cargo manager and it will help you to access different slots which you can specify in its GUI. Quite handy for pumping items in and out!

questDatabase.name: Advanced detector rail
questDatabase.description: Now that you have a cargo manager you need a specific rail so that your cart can interact with it. Just place it next to the cargo manager, depending on the color of the side it is on you will have to adjust settings in the cargo manager GUI.

questDatabase.name: Exhale of the horned one
questDatabase.description: Exhale of the Horned One is an ingredient used in many recipes. It is acquired with a random chance when burning Oak saplings in an oven.

questDatabase.name: Mutate your saplings
questDatabase.description:
Mutandis is a mutagen that is used by witches and warlocks to mutate plants into other species. Simply use Mutandis on small plants, grass, flowers, saplings, etc. and it will be randomly converted to another plant. Mutandis cannot mutate multi-stage plants like wheat and cactus.

Mutating plants is the only way to acquire Rowan, Hawthorn and Alder saplings.

Mutandis has another interesting property when crafted with raw meat. It seems to mutate it into another type of raw meat. It even seems to have an effect on Rotten Flesh.

Some recipes require Mutandis as an ingredient.

Mutandis can be upgraded to Mutandis Extremis to have effect on a wider variety of plants.

Mutandis is made in a Witches' Cauldron using Mandrake Root, Exhale of the Horned One and an Egg.

questDatabase.name: Breath o Goddess
questDatabase.description: The Breath of the Goddess is an ingredient used in many recipes. It is acquired with a random chance when burning Birch saplings in an oven.

questDatabase.name: Mutated saplings
questDatabase.description:
Rowan saplings grow into Rowan trees when planted. Rowan trees can be harvested for Rowan logs and Rowan leaves (which yield more Rowan saplings). Rowan saplings cooked in an oven yield Wood Ash, and have a chance of producing a Whiff of Magic.

Rowan saplings can initially be acquired only by using Mutandis on another planted sapling (does not matter which type). Given the mutation of the sapling is random it may take a few goes before Rowan saplings appear.

Hawthorn saplings grow into Hawthorn trees when planted. Hawthorn trees can be harvested for Hawthorn logs and Hawthorn leaves (which yield more Hawthorn saplings). Hawthorn saplings cooked in an oven yield Wood Ash, and have a chance of producing Odour of Purity.

Hawthorn saplings can initially be acquired only by using Mutandis on another planted sapling (does not matter which type). Given the mutation of the sapling is random it may take a few goes before Hawthorn saplings appear.

questDatabase.name: Whiff of Magic
questDatabase.description: A Whiff of Magic is an ingredient used in many recipes. It is acquired with a random chance when burning Rowan saplings in an oven.

questDatabase.name: Odour of Purity
questDatabase.description: Odour of Purity is an ingredient used in many recipes. It is acquired with a random chance when burning Hawthorn saplings in an oven.

questLines.name: Tier 0 - It begins
questLines.description: The very first tier, tier zero. This chapter will introduce you to the basic mechanics of this modpack. Mods covered: Vanilla, Pam's Harvestcraft.

questLines.name: Tier 0.5 - Stone Age
questLines.description: Basically the "Tier 0" of all your progression. This set helps you through the first tier until you can build your first steam machine

questLines.name: Tier 1 - Steam
questLines.description: Quest set for all steam-based machines.

questLines.name: Tier 2 - 32 EU (LV)
questLines.description:
The first "voltage" tier of this pack. Things are getting easier...
BTW, if you can't see any quests, click in the quest window or use the mousewheel to zoom in and out.

questLines.name: Tier 3 - 128 EU (MV)
questLines.description:
Your second voltage tier. Don't mix different voltage levels, or you will be punished in a hard way. Start thinking about how to expand your base. 
Again, use mousewheel to zoom out to see quests.

questLines.name: Tier 4 - 512 EU (HV)
questLines.description: Finally some power to work with. This tier will help you reach distant planets and gather more rare resources to build even more advanced machines.

questLines.name: Tier 5 - 2048 EU (EV)
questLines.description: Titanium level, fissile energy sources, Applied Energistics 2.

questLines.name: Tier 6 - 8192 EU (IV)
questLines.description: Tungsten level, Asteriod age, assembly line

questLines.name: Tier 7 - 32768 EU (LuV)
questLines.description: Fusion,

questLines.name: Fishing Farming Cooking
questLines.description: Catch it, grow it, eat it!

questLines.name: Armors and Jetpacks
questLines.description: Guiding you through the armor and jetpacks.

questLines.name: Multiblock Goals
questLines.description: This set is a global tracker for multiblock structure goals. As you can build several parts of many multiblocks way earlier than the respective tier. Check back often.

questLines.name: Steve Carts
questLines.description: Basic auto farming and mining.  Protect them from lightning strikes!

questLines.name: Forestry and Farms
questLines.description: Automated Farms and more.....

questLines.name: Coins, Coins, Coins
questLines.description:
These quests will guide you to use your Coins wisely and buy some useful or fancy stuff.
Zoom out using mousewheel to see all the amazing things for sale!

questLines.name: GT++
questLines.description: GT++ adds new functionality to GT, including high speed multiblocks - Under Construction

questLines.name: Fusion
questLines.description: Making power for the lategame tiers, LuV-UMV

questLines.name: Be(e) Breeding
questLines.description: Breeding Bees for Better Bling

questLines.name: How to be(e)
questLines.description: A non-tiered quest set that is meant as an in game, quest based tutorial and guide to bees. Since they are a really helpful tool to advance forward.

questLines.name: Novice Thaumaturge
questLines.description: Magic lies beyond. Great achievements, but also a lot of work. I shall be your guide. Follow my instructions, and you shall become a great wizard, like me.

questLines.name: Adept Thaumaturgy
questLines.description: Warp included.

questLines.name: Kaaami, Haaaami, ... HA!
questLines.description: Ultimate (magical) POWER!!!

questLines.name: Focus on Wand Foci
questLines.description: Did you know which wand focus is useful and which not?

questLines.name: Electro Magic
questLines.description: This Tab focus on Electro Magic Tools and Thaumic Energistics. These are some nice mods, that will help you with machinery and magic.

questLines.name: Alternative Magic
questLines.description: What kind of witchery is this!?

questLines.name: Paying the highest price
questLines.description: When regular magic just won't cover it, pay demons to do it for you! The cost might scare some people... But no risk no fun!

questLines.name: More blood, more stuff
questLines.description: Advanced Blood Magic? My veins feel weird...

questLines.name: They are coming...
questLines.description: The spirits that I've called... Demon invasions and beyond. Really deep into dark magic!

questLines.name: Transportation
questLines.description: From four legged steeds to iron horses

questLines.name: Space Race
questLines.description: A guide to help you start Galacticraft and reach the Moon

questLines.name: AE System
questLines.description: Applied Energistics 2 focuses on creating a compact, easily accessible, considerably extendible storage system called an ME Network.

questLines.name: Kill all the things
questLines.description: This world is full of nasty things. Time to kill some and improve your reputation.

questLines.name: To grind, or not to grind
questLines.description: That is the question. Do you want good tools? Well, then go grind stuff! The rewards of these quests are worth it, trust me.

questLines.name: Legendary Quests
questLines.description: A legendary quest-line with difficult tasks, expensive recipes and potentially dangerous locations. Are you prepared?
